name: Atlanta Botanical Garden
address: 1345 Piedmont Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews:
A great spot to spend time with your family and/or friends.

We went early spring so not a lot of outdoor flowers however the indoor is amazing. The trails are all accessible friendly for people with special needs or stroller friendly. There are multiple waterfalls, many places where you can seat, a small coffee shop.

Worthy if you do like nature and like to invest in your health

The Atlanta Botanical Garden is nestled firmly within Piedmont Park in a convenient, yet compact setting. The gardens and decor are unique and contemporary, perfectly complementing the midtown skyline that serves as the backdrop. The canopy walk is a fun, relaxing experience that extends the garden’s footprint. The Orchid Daze exhibition was fantastic, and worth the large crowds. That being said, the parking garage, entrance, and walkways are small throughout the garden, and can feel at capacity rather quickly. The large weekend crowds can make the experience somewhat stressful as the garden is small for a city of this size.

What a beautiful, peaceful oasis. Perfect for lovers of nature. A breath of fresh air hidden within the bustling streets of downtown Atlanta. Just kept getting better the more we walked and explored the grounds. The green houses were my favorite. Definitely a MUST-SEE!!!!

Lovely garden adding a pleasant bit of fitness to your day. Lots to learn in a very pleasant and delightful environment.
The frogs and orchids were a real delight, also enjoyed all the sculptures outside including the Earth Goddess. The children’s section had so many happy teeny tots, a real delight to watch. The desert zone, skyline, canopy walk, edible garden etc added their own charm to the place.
Looking forward to visiting again in spring and see the place in full bloom. Also, the volunteer opportunities are enormous- looking forward to sign up for a few to learn, serve and grow.
I would highly encourage this place for all nature enthusiasts.

Gorgeous botanical gardens. They have such nice grounds to browse through.  I love the sculpting of the plants and bushes that they do. It is really a nice time to walk around. They have little cafes inside to so you can grab a coffee and enjoy. This is not something that I would have normally done but quite glad I did!

name: World of Coca-Cola
address: 121 Baker St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: World of Coca Cola is something that everyone should take a look at when visiting Atlanta. They have a great deal of exhibitions discussing the history of Coca Cola which are fascinating. There are many rooms that display Coca Cola memorabilia. You are even able to view the secret vault where the recipe for Coca Cola is located. The visual effects of each exhibit are stimulating and fun. There are many spots for good photos such as with the Coca Cola polar bear. I especially loved the exhibit where you are able to taste test different flavors from around the world. My favorite flavors were the watermelon ones and the sour apple ones. The staff were all very friendly and informational. They show you a commercial for Coca Cola and it is very heartwarming. The gift shop is enormous with some awesome items such as glasses in all sorts of colors, a variety of keychains, and some very cute clothes. There is even an exhibition where you can view how they produce Coca Cola. The whole experience really shows you how Coca Cola brings people together from all walks of life. I would highly recommend this as a must see on your trip to Atlanta!

We paid for the VIP tour and our Steve tour guy was awesome.  Good pace, very interesting, lots of history and deliciousness.  At the beginning of the tour you get a coke zero or whatever drink you want, you get to see a lot of antiques and take picture with the polar bear.  You get to go in the vault were they have the secret recipe, you get to see the bottling process.  I got a lot more than expected.  The headsets that you use are very comfortable and super clean, you get a souvenir at the end of the tour.  You get to taste a lot of different coca colas around the world.

I called with a question after I bought my tickets and the person on the other end was both polite and friendly. I had a friend visiting from out of town and we went to visit the World of Coke together, him for the first time and me for the first time in about a decade. We did a self guided tour which allowed us to take in the exhibits at our own pace. However the staff are very courteous and ready to answer any questions you may have whether you are on an official tour or not. There are a good number of things to interact with and cater to the attention of children while for adults. There is plenty of history/nostalgia to read about/view in the various display windows. The drink tasting was as exciting as I remember it being from all those years ago and I would certainly recommend the World of Coke to anyone who hasn't been or hasn't been in a while.

Great on the history of Coca-Cola and the original secret formula is in a gigantic vault.  Fun experience in an area where you can taste soft drinks from all over the world.  Model area that shows bottling process.  But no actual Coke is made here.  Good gift shop.  Impressive concern for recycling.

I visited the world of Coke. Lots to see. Lots of facts about coke. I got an annual pass. That will pay for itself on my next visit. You can spend 3 to 4 hours there, to see everything. There is lots of taste testing of coke products around the world. America, Asia, Europe.. All over ...This is a must taste place to see. Museum is high quality learning and entertainment. The history of Coca Cola is amazing. The taste tasting center at the end of the tour is the highlight for me. The gift shop is the last place to see.

name: Piedmont Park
address: 400 Park Dr NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA
reviews: I live in the city centre and I am lucky to be able to live a few steps from Piedmont Park. Whether it is dogwood celebration or free yoga, there are always events in the park. Even on quiet Tuesdays, I like to play in the park-it's big, every inch is beautiful. Personally, I like to sit on a rocking chair and enjoy the view of the water. Nothing compares to a beauty plus a good book. If you come to us, be sure to take the time to play in our lovely park. You will not regret it. In the summer, there are free concerts at the Park Bar at sunset.

I love this park. It’s so much space for everyone. If you come here it wouldn’t be out of the ordinary to see people skating, on their bikes, riding electrical scooters (that you can usually find in the park through third parties) parents with their kids etc. this park is massive and beautiful. It’s next to the botanical garden and the parking there is very affordable.

It is truly one of my favorite places to go. Large, beautiful and peaceful surroundings. Always plenty of families and individuals enjoying the park's amenities. If you live nearby it's a great place to jog, picnic, stroll or simply take a few pictures. If you're driving into the community you'll appreciate the low cost parking. Either way the park has something for everyone.

Its very beautiful and big. If your ever in the mood for a good jog or walk, this is the park for you. It also has a children's park with swings and a slide. Not only do they have a place for you and your kids, they have a place for your dog too! They have a really nice fenced in area for your dog to run freely and have fun. It's a huge park that has something for everyone. Try it out, you'll probably like it.

Fantastic, huge park. Great place to go and watch someone destroy themselves on a bird scooter. Lots of room to skate, walk, ride a bike (and apparently unicycle). Every one smiles and waves, great vibes. There's also a dog park/training school that looks nice. There's something for everyone at this park.

name: Zoo Atlanta
address: 800 Cherokee Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30315, USA
reviews: I loved this place.  It was a very nice and neatly kept up zoo.  I loved the animal enclosures and couldn't believe how close you got to some of the animals, like the lemurs.  I would recommend this Zoo to anyone.  I also loved the fact that the zoo admission was included in a city pass booklet.  Being a tourist I loved that the zoo was included in the city pass booklet as it gave me options on where to visit while in Atlanta.  Loved the zoo and would recommend it to anyone.

We had a great time. We got lucky with the beautiful sunny but cool day and it wasn't crowded! My 3 year old twins were able to see the animals that were out without a hassle. We rented a double stroller and it made it easier for us. A lot of the animals weren't out because of the cold but overall it was a good time. We weren't able to see everything but saw all we were excited to see. The petting zoo seemed cool and the kids area ( we didnt stay there) . My girls loved the tiger,  monkeys and panda. The only thing I wish is that the sensory material was available inside the park instead of outside the main entrance. Luckily,  since it wasn't crowded or loud, we didn't need them. I did see the designated quiet areas around the park. It is a great option for those who  need it. Will definitely be going back.

Great zoo, tons of variety, and the new elephant exhibit is fantastic. Good use some maintenance of the parking (gets muddy anytime it rains) but parking is free so I cant complain too much. Food is pricey but quality is good for 'theme park food'. Plenty of opportunities to get close to the animals and the staff is friendly. The zoo is kept clean throughout the day.

Loved the Atlanta Zoo!! The exhibits were well kept and the grounds were very nice, too.  The staff were all friendly and the restrooms were clean. The staff stopped and talked to me, and they seemed to genuinely love their jobs. I had a great time and it wasn't too crowded (granted I went on a Friday but it was after a weeks worth of rain). I loved the gorilla exhibit. It was spacious, peaceful and the gorillas were amazing to watch.

We had a great experience. We’ve been to bigger zoos,  but this one is a great size.  With lots of animals and not to much walking. Nice train, petting zoo and play areas for children. We did not buy food, so I cannot comment on the prices. Shows and educational are scheduled throughout the day. The grounds were clean and well maintained. They were just finishing up on their beautifully designed elephant display.  Parking could be an issue (long walk) if you don’t arrive early. Fun day for the family.

name: The Escape Game Atlanta
address: 900 Battery Ave SE #1020, Atlanta, GA 30339, USA
reviews: I loooovvee this place! And we escaped! The staff was friendly. I’ve been to a lot of escape rooms and most of them didn’t had a intro video to show what you will be doing in the room like this place. Great location to get some food and drinks to celebrate afterwards. Can’t wait to go back!

This is one of the best escape rooms if ever been to! We did The Heist where we had to recover a Monet painting. The room was expertly decorated and designed. The puzzles were also very well done. There was only one puzzle that even with hints, didn’t really make sense. You can tell The Escape Game has thought of everything when it comes to escape rooms. The staff was very nice. They also let you get a sneak peak of a room if you can’t decide which one you want to do. Overall it was a wonderful experience and will definitely be going back to try the other escape rooms!

A must-do in Atlanta! The Escape Game has the greatest escape rooms! All of their rooms are AMAZINGLY themed (it’s like Disney World level), and the challenges are so unique & engaging. Every room has something that I would never expect to find in an Escape Room (especially Spec Ops!) And because the rooms have varied puzzles & challenges, every person on our team got a chance to solve something! I’ve loved all 5 of their games, but Gold Rush is my favorite! 
Also shout-out to their Game Guides & the whole team, they are so fun & helpful! If you’re not sure which game you’ll like best, just ask em!

This is the best escape game company hands down. Their puzzles are challenging in a fair way. There aren't any "trial and error " puzzles that sink your time. If you know the answer to something, you are instantly rewarded with a fun surprise in the environment. My favorite part is how seamlessly the puzzles blend with the atmosphere. Everything feels like it belongs and it makes you feel truly part of the experience.

Totally didn’t think Playground would be nearly as fun or challenging as it was, but whoa baby! This is a super fun room with twists and turns and it’s hard to believe they rank it 6/10! Check it out! Cody & Caleb were awesome!!

name: Fox Theatre
address: 660 Peachtree St NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Nice cozy atmosphere. Pretty good view from all seats, from what I could tell. Got through the gates pretty fast, especially for a really large crowd. Leaving was not too horrible, had to do the shoulder to shoulder shuffle until the crowd broke up outside the main entrance. An enjoyable venue for shows. I will definitely go back to see other shows/concerts there.

The Diana Ross concert at the Fox Theatre was OUTSTANDING!  Diana's voice was clear and strong (especially for her being 75 years old).  The theatre's acoustics were fantastic for the band and singers.  The ushers were very polite and helpful.  The seats were comfortable.  The bathrooms were clean and the concessions were reasonable.  It was a perfect night at The Fox!

I absolutely adore the Fox Theatre!!! 😊 As a little girl, my Grandpa Bubba would take me to the Fox Theatre to see The Nutcracker and I cherish those precious memories that I'll hold in my heart forever. Last weekend, my boyfriend and I went to see Little Big Town at the Fox and it was a phenomenal performance. The Fox Theatre was clean, gorgeous, and a true work of art, just as I had remembered it. Definitely go see a play or concert at the Fox if you have the chance. It's such a unique and special experience! ✨

It is a beautiful historic theater with elegant and exotic design. It is like being in a middle eastern temple under a night sky. It has a one of a kind atmosphere and is outstanding for concerts. For being in the heart of Atlanta, it has the high class atmosphere one would expect, but also a magnificant beauty that really stands out.  Based on it's grand architecture and historic legacy, I would highly recommend it as a standout venue ( among the many in Atlanta) to attend for entertainment.

Went to see Alvin Ailey and the show was great. I will say the cost for parking next door to the Fox is quite expensive ranging from $30-40. It's convenient but come on is $40 really necessary? I was happy that they offered snacks and drinks and of course you will pay a nice fee for that as well. Overall, it was a great show even though I still spent an additional $60 for parking and snacks.

name: High Museum of Art
address: 1280 Peachtree St NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: $15 admission cost is a ridiculous price to pay to go to one of the most well known art museums, and located in such a convenient spot in midtown Atlanta. Please do come here at least once in your life if you live in or near Atlanta, I enjoyed every story of the building as well as the multiple open exhibits that are accessed via elevator.  The entire vibe around and outside the museum is great as well, with aesthetically pleasing architecture. Going to come here again for sure.

I love everything this museum has to offer. From the sculptures, paintings, or special exhibits. We spent many hours appreciating the art on display.

Definitely a great place to visit in the city if you're a lover of the arts.

**You can't enter the museum if you buy a coffee or food. I wasn't paying attention to their signs when I first got there and had to throw my coffee away. Just a reminder**

Good art, good for college students, long-term relationship's dates, and lovers of art. Plenty of walking and some more mature themes so not great for little kids. Interesting exhibits and lovely tour guides. Fun gift shop and useful coffee shop.

I've never been to an exhibit here that was disappointing. The museum is beautiful. Love the refresh they did on their permanent exhibit, and love Second Sundays! I do wish they were open a little later. The only downside to the museum is the price of parking. But I mean, hey - it's Atlanta. Definitely try to take MARTA as there's a station right by the museum. Also, if you go into the gift shop as an exhibit is wrapping up, the exhibit-specific merchandise typically has a pretty steep discount. Did that for Infinity Mirrors ;)

Third time back at the High.  This time for their Frequency Fridays. This is such a beautiful art museum with great exhibits.  Great dining options from coffee bar ( serving cocktails) to cafe to fine dining at Twelve Eighty.

name: Center For Puppetry Arts
address: 1404 Spring St NW, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: My husband and I went here as part of our Valentine's Day weekend! It was absolutely spectacular! I knew I would be impressed, but wow! If you are a Jim Henson fan, GO! It was amazing seeing some of my favorite characters, from The Labyrinth and The Dark Crystal.

Always a great time at this museum! I love how I can see several different puppets each visit as they rotate the exhibits about twice a year. The guided tour is very much worth the price of admission but just going through on your own is quite enjoyable too! A great place to take out of town guests - especially if they are Jim Henson/Muppet fans!

I have always loved the Center and have taken my children there for 20 years now. However we went on a recent field trip (reduced rate is good) and saw Stellaluna. The play, though good enough in itself, was performed in an overt style (seeing the puppeteers in the open) was disappointing. I'm an adult and I know there are people working the puppets. I just don't want to see them, watch their mouths move along with the puppets' mouths and see them as part of the performance. The smaller children there didn't seem to mind, but mine were disappointed...and so was I. The regular ticket price is a bit much at $25. Try to set up a field trip with 10 or more and it's about half price, including a make a puppet workshop. It can be quite unorganized in the workshop if a lot of children are participating, so ask for the puppet kit to go if you're a loner, have several small children to help or strapped for time. They are always fun and usually include all you need to complete it at home. For educators or home-schooled families, there are usually resources and extra related info on the website, or within the program leaflet. Also, a coordinator can give you more info on resources as well.

It was an awesome place. They have interactive displays along with some historical information on puppetry. We loved the Stellaluna puppet show, it was fun for kids and adults. It was easy enough to get to with GPS and they also have a few benches and tables outside that made it great for a small picnic. All in all a fun and intriguing place to go

Just visited yesterday to see the Dark Crystal exhibit and truly this was a very memorable museum experience. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice, and overall I'm stunned how much there is too look at with the admission price. The Jim Henson exhibit really made me feel nostalgic and I was in awe seeing those puppets in person! The Dark Crystal exhibit was above and beyond, I am still so thrilled I got to see these puppets in person! In my opinion, this museum is a must do if you are in Atlanta!

name: Chick-fil-A College Football Hall of Fame
address: 250 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: Neat place. They've done a very good job with the fan interactions. Overall pretty neat for even average and die hard college football fans. However, when it came to the employees level of attitude, kindness, and helpfulness, you were either great or horrible. Some employees treated us like little kids while we were there pushing us around or being forceful. Some were just rude. The other half of employees were amazing. It's a cool place to visit. Recommended spending about 2 hours here.

Just wanted to drop you a line to say thank you to the amazing staff at College Football Hall of Fame in Atlanta for making my visit an exceptional and memorable experience. As a classical pianist and first generation American with parents who never watched any traditional American sports, I am probably one of the least likely people to ever visit any sports facility or hall of fame. I think it's safe to say that I never would have gone if I weren't dragged in by my friend.

WOW - what a wonderfully interactive and fun experience it ended up being! I felt welcome. from the moment I walked in and was warmly greeted by Evin. The personalization of displays throughout my trip through the museum made it that much more fun, and I was fascinated by the exhibits about the people, philosophy, and history of the sport. From the analogies to training for life (which I can relate to as a musician), to the evolution of technology  in gear and safety equipment, to the motivational film that actually got me excited to attend a game in the future, to the chance to test my speed, vertical jump, and finally throw and kick on the field, I enjoyed every moment and left the building with an ear-to-ear grin. Consider me a fan!

Thank you to all,
Elizabeth

This was where my boyfriend and I had our first official date. It's a great place to be in a relaxed environment and to learn college football facts and history. You can bring your camera and take picture and there is a lot of memorabilia that you can photograph. This place is very family friendly.  Wear comfortable shoes, as you will do a lot of walking in this multi-level facility. Overall you will enjoy!

If you are a college football fan, this is a must see attraction in Atlanta.  Even if your not a CFB fan, I think you will have a great time. This is a great way to spend time as a family in Atlanta.  Our 7 year old and 10 year old had an amazing time. They loved the interactive activities like the vertical jump and 40 yard dash. And of course they loved the chance to kick a field goal and run some receivers routes. Spent about four hours there and could have stayed longer.  Can’t wait to visit again!

I'm not a big fan of sports in general but this place was impressive. Larger than I thought from looking at it outside. They have a small theater, many displays and attractions. Also interactive exhibits like record your own commentary of a famous play, be in a televised broadcast as an announcer, measure your vertical leap, ride in the good year blimp, and kick your own field goal. It is attached to the Omni hotel for an easy walk there.

name: Georgia Aquarium
address: 225 Baker St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: The aquarium is great. Our kids had a blast. I had a blast. The whale sharks are amazing and majestic. The manta rays are enormous and beautiful. There are a lot of exhibits. I would definitely recommend being 30-40 minutes early to the dolphin show or you won't get a seat. We barely missed getting seats.

Very big one. One of the finest aquariums I have visited. Dolphin show was superb. I usually avoid these shows because they torture dolphins. But this was great. Felt dolphins liked it. Handled by professionals. Great job.

There are various aquatic displays and creatures to see. It is a great experience for anyone that hasn't been. Tour organization could be a little better as far as someone giving suggestions on a path to take from beginning to end, but free exploration is great too. Touch exhibits are a great inclusion of the aquarium, just make sure to listen and follow the instructions of the guide at the exhibit for your safety and the safety of the creatures. This is a place to take the kids or just a romantic date. There are room in some exhibits for strollers and scooters for those that need them. There are also elevators for access to the second floor. The dolphin show was an awesome experience to be a part of as well. This is definitely a place you need to check out at least once.

Such a beautiful place! The exhibits are huge and set up to accurately represent the natural environment of the organisms living in them. There's this tunnel, completely made of glass, that crosses through one of the largest tanks in the aquarium. Here you can see all different kinds of sharks, fish, and even the whale shark swimming right over your head. It's magical! It's also a great place to take kids, where everyone in the family can have a good time.

This was worth a visit and the cost. I have seen a few shows and movies that were filmed at this aquarium and it was SO cool to be able to see the whale shark exhibit so close in person. It was a beautiful experience and there is nothing quite like it. Their research also speaks to their progressive efforts of sustainability and conservation. I love learning about their rehabilitation of animals in general. Definitely will be going back.

name: Delta Flight Museum
address: 1220 Woolman Pl, Hapeville, GA 30354, USA
reviews: As someone that loves aviation this place is amazing. The 747 is full of history and so iconic, it was just amazing to get into the first queen of the skies that was built for passenger use and flew for 30 yrs she has history in every corner! Everyone here was amazing and very helpful! If you use Google maps to get here it will tell you to make a left at the very end of the instructions on how to get there but it's wrong, just keep straight for another 8th of a mile and the actual place will be on the left. You can see the hangar that says Delta flight museum. Stop at the front where the guards are, they will check your Id give you a parking pass and give you stickers that read Delta museum guest. Find a parking Spot put the stickers on yourself and walk into the brick building to the right of the first big hangar it has landing gear posts on the outside of it. Go in and the building through security get your passes and hit the 747 before you go in as I closes earlier than the building. Also they have guided Douglas DC-3(Ship 41) tours every second Tuesday of every month, for a very short time so make sure to call before and be there. This place is awesome for young ones and parking is free!!! You can also see incoming and outgoing traffic in the airport from the parking lot which is a big plus for me! There's a fully working B737 simulator in there that costs a little over 400 bucks for an hour for up to 4 people if I'm not mistaken check the website for the details and have some fun. Plan to be here 2 to 3 hours for an in depth visit!

I’ve been to Atlanta a lot in my life and just now stopped in to see the Delta flight museum.  It was a good way to pass an extra hour or so.  Most of the exhibits are interesting.  It’s cool to see a 747 and go upstairs, but it would have been even cooler to have that upstairs be retrofitted back to the swanky days of flying, rather than just see it full of “Delta One” Business Class seats.  The 767 is a bit more interesting because it still has parts of the cabin from the 80s and has that vintage smell.  Not quite on par with the Museum of Flight in Seattle, but not bad.

Not too many exhibits but there’s a rare Waco 125 which is very nice. The DC-3 is gorgeous too. Very well presented and lots of Delta memorabilia to see. The shop is well stocked. Would be great if they had a cafe or restaurant. Check out the cool Mini in the car park too!

Very cool place for aviation fans. Learned some cool trivia. They have a 747 and another plane you can walk through. They also have a 737? Full on flight simulator for extra cost. It costs $15 each but half off for military and Delta employees/guests groups of up to 25 can get in for $100 so that's a cool deal too.

Perfect for an avgeek or just persons with interest in the topic to spend a few hours. Various exhibits from the whole history of this airline, of which many are planes, of course (including a 747 and a 767 which you can explore from their inside). Nice gift shop, too, with a good choice of items and fair prices. Take the information provided with a grain of salt, though, as it is (obviously) a corporate museum.
The museum is located in the Delta HQ. That means there is no separate entrance for it; you just go through the regular gate, get your ID checked and receive a sticker saying you're a museum visitor.

name: Krog Street Tunnel
address: 1 Krog St NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: one of my favorite go to spots for all of your impromptu last minute photo and/or video shoot needs! a great “tourist” location that mirrors the melting pot East/Atlanta really is; it’s amazing to see so much talent in one place and each piece stand out and on its own! must see, family friendly

Krog street tunnel is always worth a look at, if not for the art, but for the fact that it's the biggest headache trying to turn under/into going left  headed down Decatur St that I have ever had the displeasure of attempting in Atlanta, and every time I am there, at least three people are either going to run the red light, or attempt to run the light only to slam on their brakes at the last minute.

It's really best to visit on foot. It's a pretty iconic spot in Atlanta, and while it's not quite at the landmark level of the Big Chicken, most people at least know OF it, if not exactly how to get there.

I am always happy whenever I find myself traveling in through & around this vicinity. The creativity that lives in the air & atmosphere always seems to draw my attention.  Artsy, vibracious, colorific, cool, fun...list of adjectives goes on! Love it!

Holy Cow! This place is INSANE! So much to look at and a really cool place to take pictures! 📷  It was definetly worth the 40 minute walk. Also fun fact; Tori Kelly's 'It Should've Been Us' has parts of the tunnel in her song. Kinda cool 😎

The Krog street tunnel was an amazing stop to visit not being from Atlanta this tunnel was a site to see and if you're an artist this is a must see. So many different styles of artistry that you will be there for at least 30 minutes to an hour looking at this amazing display of creativity.

name: Atlanta History Center
address: 130 West Paces Ferry Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: There were some really cool exhibits, my favorite being about handmade crafts in Atlanta/Georgia. Emory’s Laney Graduate School hosted its annual gala there and the setting was good. There were lots of places to take pictures.

I enjoyed my first experience at the Atlanta History Center. This is a great place to see the history in plain view. My kids enjoyed themselves as well but my most enjoyable moment was the play about "John Lewis's speech".

Very disappointing...Took friends from out of town to the new location as we have always had great feedback from visitors that we have taken to the old location. We were so looking forward to this and couldn’t have been more let down, no theater or narration, the story of the battle is gone and so is the ability to sit and be told a story. It’s like the museum purposely decided to take the heart out of the attraction. Embarrassed to have had guests pay $21.50 each to listen to a guy with a laser flashlight point out random images on the canvas.  Won’t go back...they really ruined it.

My family and I really enjoyed the Atlanta History Museum.  There were some really neat exhibits and some really amazing stories and artifacts! I loved the fact that they have the Swan House and Smith Family Farm as a part of the museum.  I did feel like there could have been more in certain areas and that they could have delved deeper into much of the history of Atlanta.  I wasn’t able to see the 360*? Part of the museum but will definitely go back to experience that!  If you love Museum or don’t have a lot of experience with them this is a really good place to start!

Relaxing and fun place.
The history center is great to come and spend a leisure Sunday.
Things to do, food to eat, and tons and amazing things to see.
There is admission to the museum.
But I think it is worth it.

name: Atlanta Movie Tours, Inc.
address: 327 Nelson St SW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: Great experience! We drove 2 hours to take this tour. The staff is very knowledge and entertaining and most of all patient with my 9 year old who loves to talk.

I. Can’t. Even. This was so fun and so informative for a stranger things fan!!!!  My son (12) and I went to celebrate his birthday - we had a blast. So so many great stops where the show was filmed!  Kevin the tour guide was hilarious and so great at telling us all the insider scoop and Mike was a fantastic driver. We had a blast!!!!

Atlanta Movie Tours designed a custom private tour for our group of about 20. These family members spanned 3 generations.   The tour included locations for shows like Walking Dead and Stranger Things for the younger ones, plus Baby Driver and Driving Miss Daisy for the older set. In addition we enjoyed a delicious lunch and challenging escape rooms. The entire experience took nearly 5 hours. It was absolutely top notch in all respects. As we drove from place to place our guides (Colin and Sydney) shared several entertaining stories about their stints as film extras. Both kept us informed and entertained the entire time. We arranged the tour with Anna, who cheerfully made several last minute adjustments at our request. Her flexibility and quick responses to changes could not have been better. I would recommend Atlanta Movie Tours to anyone seeking first class entertainment about TV shows and movies filmed in the Atlanta area.

Great tour for all Stranger Things fans! Enough time for pictures and very well curated! This tour is not only for the Upside Down fans but for all the attendees and movie lovers. Colin, Mike and the entire crew are fantastic, and the bus is very comfortable and well driven and navigated. Will definitely recommend if you happen to be in Atlanta.

My wife and I went on the Best of Atlanta today, and Mike and Kevin made it a trip to remember. There were movie locations and facts galore, reroute due to a marathon, and even a warehouse fire to round out the trip. Kevin and Mike took everything in stride and made it a tour to remember.

Next time we're back in Atlanta, we'll come back and do another tour for sure. And I'll be recommending this to anybody I know who comes to Atlanta.

Thanks for a great time guys!

name: Grant Park
address: 90 Cherokee Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Loved the ZOO!! Easy to park, and a short stroll in takes you to another world of wild animals in well-kept habitats, fun rides on a carousel or a train, and a great challenge involving harnesses that we'll tackle next time! Plenty of places to snack or rest and enjoy the shade. Local favorite. Well worth it. Arrive early!
A noble idea of creating a clean and safe space for city goers to relax or exercise. I enjoyed walking even at night while my daughter and wife enjoyed taking a walk.

In my opinion it's a really pretty park not one I would bring young kids to but maybe older kids  or a significant other there's a really nice bridge and your close to water. It could be a really romantic setting. In my defense I didn't explore some of the park so I could of missed some stuff but it's still really nice

Great zoo. One of the best I've ever seen. Kept very clean. A few animals missing which I know they are either being cared for or hiding but seemed like quite a few. With that said lots of expansions happening and remodeling so I will definitely return in a few years to check it out again. Worth the trip.

Amazing zoo! The price is well worth it, the variety of animals is great! It took my party which included a little one about two hours to see everything. The playground was great for the little ones and gave everyone a break from walking while they exhausted themselves. I can't wait for the new exhibits coming in the coming months!

name: SkyView Atlanta
address: 168 Luckie St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: A great view of the downtown from the top of the Sky-view. A great ride! This is really lovely experience here with amazing view.Loved it.Overall I would definitely recommend it. Attentive and fun staff - well managed; cabins are secure and air conditioned; ride was 4 rotations which was about 15 min long. The pods that you ride in are quite roomy, they are enclosed and have huge windows and the view is fantastic! The ride also takes you around several times so you have a long time to enjoy yourself! Perfect ending to a romantic date. Highly recommend coming right as the sun is setting. The view from the very top is amazing. Ticket prices are reasonable and the time you get to ride is reasonable too.

My wife and I took a ride on our date! We got to see such a spectacular view of Atlanta after dark. Everything around us was lit up. It was beautiful. The best part is that we were in a nice, cozy space when we rode around, it made our date feel more special.

Nice ride and worth the money. This is accessible to people in wheelchairs who may take their wheelchair within the car. The only negative is that not all the lights were working and it would’ve been prettier with all the lights working. I will ride this again

We had an amazing experience with my son at the SkyView Ferris wheel. It’s a great thrill while you get to enjoy the great views of Downtown Atlanta. The cabins were maintained clean and provided enough room for us. I really recommend this to families and while at this location will also enjoy great food and drink. The entire experience is worth the price.

This Ferris wheel is iconic; you always see it on TV when there's a game in Atlanta.  That makes it worth doing in my book.  And yes the views were great!  I took off two stars because (1) my daughter is in middle school, but they wouldn't give her a student discount (excuse us for not knowing her student ID was needed on a short vacation), and (2) I don't like mandatory photo poses.

name: Pemberton Place
address: 126 Ivan Allen Jr Blvd NW, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Loved visiting the Aquarium with my 3 year old. My daughter didn't want to go back home. Kids are going to enjoy a lot hear. A must see attraction where there is so much to explore and informative. The dolphin show was amazing. Gazing the large tank with the soothing music played in the background made me feel like I was in a dream world. Amazing place. Would love to visit again.

Its a very ordinary aquarium, but very crowded as it is in the middle of Atlanta. Besides the large window in the picture (very cool), I didn’t see anything special since I rather see animals in something resembling their habitat instead of shows forcing them to do tricks. Good place to take kids though. I think it would be a 4 star for kids, easily.

Loved the Coke Museum, always a fun place to go and try the flavors of soda from around the world.Plus going around the museum's story line is very interesting. PLUS I AM A LOYAL DIET COKE DRINKER.PLUS LOVE CHERRY COKE ZERO.The  aquarium was interesting also .I love the place but it was very crowded with a bunch of rude visitors from other countries.They thought they could just get in front of you while you were trying to read or look at something.No manners at all .I was a little disappointed about that.But still had a fairly good visit.😇

Whenever I travel I try to find a Hooters because I love their wings. I had some time to kill before I flew home. The wings were excellent and the fries were awesome. The staff wasn't the best. I hadn't seen my server in a while and stopped another to ask for some more dip. She was very put off and pointed and shouts across the room to my server that I needed help. It was pretty rude.  But, at least the wings were great.

World of Coca-cola was a lot of fun! Dressed up for Christmas? Even better! If you are a fan of Coca-Cola, this is a must see. The highlight for me was tasting the different Coke brand soft drinks from around the world. The exit is through the gift shop, where you can purchase almost anything Coke related that you could want.

name: Swan House at Atlanta History Center
address: 130 West Paces Ferry Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: Great historic center. The group that I was with came in with someone who was very familiar and very passionate about southern history. We really enjoyed ourselves. There was definitely more than enough to come back several times or spend a very long day at the history center for those who really dig this kind of place.

This place was great, my daughter loves the hunger games movies, it was very neat seeing the house in person. She was in astonishment telling me what rooms played a big part in the movie.. And it's nice being directly behind the Atlanta history center, lots to see there as well
Dope I love seeing how rich people used to live.  There was a wedding taking pictures outside it's a great place for pics for sure

Beyond neat! Stepping into the house you immediately feel like you're a part of history and almost like deja vu because it's so well preserved...nothing was missing. Even an iron board within the maid's room was left standing for realism. Her personal decor with memories of loved ones. Was like visiting someone and you were waiting for them to walk back into the room. The front entrance is of grandeur with a beautiful water fountain. The black and white checker floors was a treat to witness. Lounging in an outside area that's not easily noticed from the drive way. It's definitely worth seeing again to have the information ingrained.

Swan house is beautiful time capsule that takes you through early 20th century daily life of a wealthy Atlanta family. The house is well maintained and fits the beautiful landscape its built on. The rooms are magnificent and the grounds has one of the best examples of landscape stepped fountains in America. I loved exploring the place.

name: Krog Street Market
address: 99 Krog St NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: Love this cute market! Has a bunch of really cool restaurants and dessert spots to have a good time! It gets really busy and packed during the weekend, especially during peak hours for dinner- so you may not find a seat If you have a big party! Earlier then better- and reservations are recommended for the sit down restaurants.

This market was cool. Right off the beltway. It had one of those large communal cafeterias. The bathrooms were a bit of a walk and difficult to find, but still a great experience. Parking, like most places in Atlanta, sucks though. Be prepared.

Krog Street Market is not necessarily as bustling or expansive as the Ponce market, but the offerings are still quite varied and tasty. I was surprised at the limited chicken places in here. Space to idle is limited, though they do have standing tables for you to eat your food at. Bathrooms are in the back, with particularly long lines for the ladies during peak times. Parking is packed.

A trendy example of the type of urban renewal sweeping across East Atlanta. Lots of shops and restaurants and easily accessible from the belt line. It’s stellar reputation as a must-see when in Atlanta is well earned.

Very busy on a Saturday evening, but the food was delicious! We ordered a variety for things from different vendors and it was all great! (Which sounds unbelievable, but that was our experience) My only recommendation is to find a less-busy time to visit.

name: Children's Museum of Atlanta
address: 275 Centennial Olympic Park Dr NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: My kids absolutely love this place. It's one of very few places a kid can run and play without getting into trouble. It's hard for me to keep up. The reason for 4 stars is, this museum is for children. We, the adults/parents/caretakers are there to keep an eye on them and to make sure they are safe. We have to pay the same admission price as kids just to watch our own children. With that being said, we will surely return because the kids do love it.

Pretty disappointed that the whole place was designed at best for kids up to about 8. A few tweaks like instructions for certain stations to explain how they are supposed to work would have helped (especially on the airflow setup with the plastic balls) definitely not remotely as good as the Indianapolis children's museum. This one resembles a cool playground much more than a place to learn and see cool things like the physics of gearing, hydraulics, air and electricity.

We went for our younger daughter's 1st grade field trip. Everyone seemed to enjoy it and wanted to come back with their own family. The staff was excellent and made the experience even more fun. Our (Blue Crew) guide kept us all entertained and kept the kids focused at all the sections. Straight lines and answering quick math questions before we moved on. He did a great job. We definitely  will be returning at some point, at the request of our daughter.

Great place to take your child. Its got so much for them to do and its educational! So they learn as they play. The museum is Huge, we've been twice now and we still have not seen and done everything there is. What's great also is that it's safe for kids, no adult is allowed in without a child and they require that you supervise your child throughout your time there. Definitely a place I would recommend getting a membership to, it'll save you a lot of $$ in the long run.

Great place for kids.   Lots odd indoor activites for rainy days.   Besides just activities there are some with educational value but mostly things to do.   Some educational shows at 11 am and noon.   Membership is great if you live in Atlanta.   Place can keep your kids busy for 2-3 hours.   Being your own snacks for upstairs eating area.

name: Michael C. Carlos Museum
address: 571 South Kilgo Cir NE, Atlanta, GA 30322, USA
reviews: Very large Museum. We have the audio tour which slowed us down a little bit so we ended up staying over three and a half hours. Loved everything about it and extremely cheap for the amount of knowledge in history you can obtain. All the staff that we encountered were very nice and helpful

The Michael C. Carlos Museum is an art museum located in Atlanta on the historic quadrangle of Emory University's main campus. The Carlos Museum has the largest ancient art collections in the Southeast, including objects from ancient Egypt, Greece, Rome, the Near East, Africa and the ancient Americas. The collections are housed in a Michael Graves designed building which is open to the public. One of the oldest museums in Georgia, the museum's collections date back to 1876, when a general museum known as Emory College Museum was established on Emory University's original campus in Oxford, Georgia. After the university was relocated to Atlanta, a small group of professors officially founded the Emory University Museum in 1919. The collections were housed and displayed in various buildings around the campus. Over the years, Atlanta businessman Michael C. Carlos donated over $20 million to create a permanent home for the museum, which opened in 1985. The museum was renamed again to the Emory University Museum of Art and Archaeology and was officially accredited by the American Alliance of Museums as a museum of antiquities and fine arts. Carlos died in December 2002 at the age of 75. A major expansion in 1993 transformed the museum into one of Atlanta's top arts institutions. Upon the new building's opening, the museum became known as the Michael C. Carlos Museum, named after its most generous patron.

Driving to parking deck was a breeze. The walk to the Museum short. The greeter near the entrance was so interesting that me and my Mom laughed and talked with her. The exhibits far exceeded my expectations. I can go every day for a week and not, ever, get bored. The staff was knowledgeable, friendly, quiet and dressed to impress. The book store is equipped with topics that are amazing. To top it off there's Ebrik coffee and more. Yes I have to mention the Ladies rooms are sparkling clean.

Went for an educator evening. High quality exhibit, and we were offered food and wine plus posters and other goodies. The collections represent a wide array of cultures throughout History. Highly recommend a visit!
I went here to listen to great music at a kid friendly concert. Had a lovely time! :D Wasn't sure where to park though, so I parked at the hospital parking garage, which was a 15 min walk away :/

name: Oakland Cemetery
address: 248 Oakland Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews:
ABSOLUTELY LOVE this location.  It is just SO BEAUTIFUL.  I have been to many a cemeteries throughout the United States over the years, having photographed pretty much most of them, and the Oakland Cemetery ranks right near the top of the list for me.  

And the staff that work there are BEYOND incredible.  Just ... WOW!  No matter when you go, they are just UNBELIEVABLE AWESOME!  Love Them Too. 

I am so glad I now live in the Atlanta area so I can go and walk the grounds whenever I get the chance.  Just a WONDERFUL experience.

Hands down one of the prettiest  cemeteries I have seen; and no I’m not someone who just marches around graves, but yes I have seen my share. 
There is so much beauty here and many incredible pieces of history. 
They have free audio tours which I would have enjoy had time not been a constant. 
I would go back with just me as I am the spooky one of the two of us in a second.

Beautiful old cemetery with several gorgeous statues and mausoleums. The staff I spoke to were very friendly and extremely informative. Fantastic place to explore, take photos, or go for a jog. Parts of the cemetery are still going through restoration, which is unusual for many old cemeteries, as once the lots are filled and the city no longer funds it, the cemetery usually goes into ruin. We're very fortunate to have the Historic Oakland Foundation working hard to keep the grounds maintained and also to provide historical tours and information on the cemetery.

Want a downtown walk outside the hustle and bustle of Atlanta?  Try Oakland Cemetery.  Beautiful, historic, and pleasant.  You’ll find something different with each visit and yet you will not tire of going back.

The walk inside Oakland Cemetery is so nice and peaceful with some pretty great views of the city skyline. The aesthetically pleasing memorials, monuments, trees, and garden are what make this cemetery worth the visit. Such a great place to stop by if you're on Memorial Drive.

name: Jimmy Carter Presidential Library and Museum
address: 441 John Lewis Freedom Pkwy NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: Serene and quiet, the Jimmy Carter Presidential Library and Museum sits nestled on a hill eliciting just the right amount of curious visitors. Gift shop prices are quite reasonable. There is a $12 fee to enter the museum, but I spent my time outside enjoying the Japanese garden which is free. My first time visiting a presidential center and quite neat.

My husband and I visited Jimmy Carter Presidential Library and Museum last Dec., we thought it will be a small museum, but we are so glad it is an excellent and large museum. There is a lot of good information/pictures/TV program about Mr. Jimmy Carter, especially his post-presidential life. We felt very encouraging by him. He is a man who is truly believing in God’s words, and his actions shows that. Definitely worth the trip.

This is great value for the $12 entrance fee! The place is laid out well, going through Carter's life from the beginning until now, so you can start out knowing nothing about him and come out feeling like an expert! There were few videos and most of the museum was signs to read, but it was interesting enough to keep our group engaged for 3 whole hours!

Nice museum and not overwhelming with information and displays.  You can easily get through this in 2 hours. This is not a Democrats vs. Republican experience.  You truly leave with a sense of who Jimmy Carter was and what he accomplished in his four years in office and more importantly, what he did after he left after.  Worth the visit to see what a servant of the people really looks like.

Truly a historical center leaving visitors inspired to go Be the Change in the World. I was a child when President Cater was elected and lived his life through the eyes of my grandmother. Out of the many places to visit on Atlanta, during a short visit, my daughter  and me choose this place of recorded legacy. The beauty of faith, diplomacy, family, favor, unity and love for America brought tears of hope to my eyes. The staff were just as beautiful asking what I felt after the tour. Jimmy Carter...Thank you for your service. You did good for America and God bless you and your family.

name: Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park
address: 450 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews: I really loved visiting. It was great reflecting on the person he was and all that he accomplished at his young age. He was a man with a tremendous love for God and a deep desire to serve Him. I missed the tour of ML's childhood home because they were full for the day. Get your tickets early in the morning if you plan on visiting the house. Everything is free and there was plenty of parking. The place was clean and everyone was friendly and helpful. I spent about three hours there, watching the videos and taking everything in. It's a wonderful place and would love to come back.

I was on vacation in Atlanta for a week. My partner and I decided to go into the city and explore. We went to this great plane, it was serreal that this is history. A great man was present there and I got to see it all with my own eyes. There is so much to see and discover, you could be there for a good few hours just looking and reading everything. The atmosphere was calm and it was a great plane to visit. Its all free and they have a little gift shop where you can buy little things. The tour guide did a great job, the information he shared was really good. Visit there if you can.

Very interesting set of historical buildings in the area.  From the church the King Family pastor'd to the King Family House.  The King Birth House is a great tour if you can get tickets.  Tickets are limited and must be obtained at the Visitor Center first.  Then you get your tickets, from the visitor center, at the distribution time, then go on the tour.  Highly worth getting there promptly at 9am to ensure you get tickets.

Great place for schools trip or family trip.  Very enlightening and educational.  Self explanatory so no official for needed. Could be emotional for older generations.  Would definitely return and recommend. My 11yr old found it extremely interesting.

Amazing yet somber place. This is a great tribute to an even greater man.  Park staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We are already planning our trip back during the summer to see the roses in bloom.

name: LEGOLAND Discovery Center Atlanta
address: 3500 Peachtree Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30326, USA
reviews: I read a lot of negative reviews and was beginning to worry...however they couldn’t have been further from the truth. The employees were amazing!  They were kind and helpful and very accommodating. The center was very well maintained, clean and orderly.  My son play for hours and hours!  The prices for admission, food and drinks were very reasonable. Our family had a wonderful time!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Kids enjoyed everything. We will definitely be back.

They lose points on this visit for a malfunctioning 4D theater, effectively a 2D theater, and the carnival ride had a car closed.

Make sure you buy your tickets online rather than at the door.

My son and I got to the discovery center when they opened at 10, we were the only ones there for a while but the staff was very helpful and interactive. Jack especially made our visit great because he kept building my son different cars to race down the track when it was just us. I highly recommend it for anyone with little kids.

Would give it 0 if possible.  Should have believed the negative reviews on google. We had tickets for 3PM, and when we got there they told us that we're had till 3:30pm because someone was having a private party. They apologized, but wasted my time and my kids time. We did not have time for anything. DO NOT GO! Use the money in something else and something better. We had a party of six and paid for all the tickets ourselves.  It was between monster jam and Lego land. With the money we spent we could have bought the kids as many Lego toys as they wanted.

Fun place for kids 4-12. There are Lego themed activites, rides, shows, and playground. Like an upscale Chuck E Cheese. The entertainment time is about 2-3 hours. Makes for good place for a birthday party. It is well lit with vibrant colors which makes is a good place to go to "lighten-up" during the cold gloomy winter days. They pay attention to all the details including the re-entry hand stamp.

name: Ebenezer Baptist Church
address: 101 Jackson St NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews:
I have visited the Historic Ebenezer Baptist Church on several occasions over the years.  I highly recommend everyone take the opportunity to visit this site should you be in the Atlanta area.  There is no cost of entry or to park; I have always been able to find a parking spot close by.
On one occasion we were able to sit in on a live presentation by one of the Park Rangers who attended Ebenezer Baptist at the same time as Dr King.  This was, by far, our most memorable visit.  On our most recent visit, however, the ranger informed us that such presentations no longer take place.  
It is incredibly inspirational to be in the very church where Dr Martin Luther King, Jr grew up and preached.  Dr King’s message of unity and peace is clearly demonstrated in the church and park on the same grounds.
The only criticism I have is I have encountered several other visitors who have been much less than friendly.  It seems Dr King’s message of love and acceptance are not necessarily ascribed to by everyone who visits.  
All said, this site is a MUST VISIT!

Very cool piece of history.  The basement as a few areas of information and exhibits.  It is also where the bathroom is located.  The main congregation area was great to just sit and absorb.  Highly recommend it.  It is free, does not take very long but is very important and moving.

Really enjoyed service here last Sunday. Famous churches like this run the risk of feeling more like a tourist attraction than a place of worship but the focus was squarely on the word. Outside homage is paid to its famous former pastor, Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., but inside you know you are in a church. Would love to return on my next visit to Atlanta.

Visiting this church will change your life! To see the actual pulpit where Dr. King preached from, to kneel in the pews that his congregation knelt in was the highlight of my trip to Atlanta. They have historic sermons playing inside the church which made it even more memorable. 
The staff were very helpful. Clean bathrooms! 
I took the subway train and walked to the area. I made an afternoon of visiting area by going to the MLK National Historic Park and visitors center, visited the church, and then went to the cemetery by the train station. Signs everywhere ask tourists to not give money to the panhandlers, and there were quite a few. I tried to stop in a bodega for a soda, big mistake, very scary. 
Visiting Ebenezer is absolutely worth the time and will make a trip to Atlanta more memorable!

The order of service was excellent, and the breakfast before service was tasty with enough time to fellowship with others. The historic church was awe inspiring to say the least. They had a guest preacher when I visited. Grateful to see both the current and original church side by side. Much history to see and hear in this place. Highly recommend you to see both venues and read all there plaques.

name: Museum of Design Atlanta (MODA)
address: 1315 Peachtree St NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: OMG..not just entertaining...but educating as well. Ms.Kluzic...the young lady from Oklahoma and ms.malaysia...left a very good impression on us. I hope I got their names right...but all 4 young ladies on 3/3/20 @1 pm were SO POLITE AND WILLING TO HELP...WISH I KNEW ALL THEIR NAMES!! THANKS GIRLS AND ALOHA!

Thrilled that this was my first experience at an art museum in town. Visitor Services staff is very welcoming, friendly, and informative. As a new transplant and fellow art museum employee, I sincerely appreciate the service here. Exhibit was thought provoking as well! I look forward to visiting again. 

High art museum could learn a lot from you!! :)

This is my son's second design class and he enjoyed it very much. The instructors are very patient and passionate about teaching the classes. We're looking forward to joining more classes and design camps. The staff was very pleasant and welcoming. Thank you MODA for offering so many opportunities for children to enjoy.

It is OK if you happen to be near by, used the metro and maybe during their weekly tour.They don''t have a permanent display and only one single exhibit with posters. You will not see what is shown on line, these are from previous exhibits. Last choice compared to other museums i visited in the area such as the Fed museum for instance that is free and It was much better, very educational with nice displays.

I love coming here for Jazz nights. I am a student member at this museum so all the jazz nights are for free, but in general coming here is like therapy. I'd recommend other people to come here and experience everything!

name: Fountain of Rings
address: 265 Park Ave W NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: Not only beautiful to watch the fountains dance, bring a towel and dance inside the spouts! Feel like a kid and be free!
Went to the Christkindl Market with family.  Had nice time. Good German food, too.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon after a visit to the aquarium and decided to sit on one of the benches under the trees and just people watch. 

Such a peaceful place with the sounds of children playing in the fountains and so many folks from all walks of life milling around. Felt totally safe and was a great place to just sit and chill and enjoy life.
This is an awesome place for kids only thing is that there is no public restroom
OMG! So much fun!! My kids had a blast!! It looked so fun I REALLY wanted to go in but I was a tad older than all the kids running around. Maybe next time I’ll join in! Highly recommended!

name: Time to Escape: The Escape Room Experience (Downtown)
address: 231 Peachtree St NE b19, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: I invited a group of friends to this experience to help celebrate my birthday on a Saturday night. Our Co-Pilot, Hannah, was very helpful and did a great job. My advice on how to conquer these experiences, especially like The Grand Zeppelin, is if you have a group of people, then split up. This way you save more time and will also have a better chance at getting all the clues. My group did not complete the experience in the 60 minutes allotted, but if we had 5 more minutes, then we would have. Regardless, everyone had a great time and said they would try another experience, which is great. The only complaint is the fact the A/C was off and the main room was a bit hot. So, it would be nice if  management would turn on the A/C on the weekends since the space is a bit confined.  Besides, this, if you're interested and want to try it, then I say go for it.

This is one of the best rooms we have ever done (and we have done many).  The staff were super friendly.  The room was different from what we have done in the past, but definitely challenging.  We got out with 4.16 minutes to spare.  We will be back to try the others.

For our son’s 8th birthday, we did the Grand Zeppelin with Andrew. He effortlessly hosted our party of six loud and excited boys and four adults through this adventure. He was very patient with the kids while managing to stay in character.
I found the game play to be challenging, but not impossible. The decor and set dressing were well thought out, with multiple layers that helped  sell the scene. There were some fun gadgets and unexpected surprises that provided a rewarding payoff.
After the Grand Zeppelin, we retired to a party room which the staff had set up for us, complete with tables and tablecloths for both serving and sitting, chairs, balloons, decor, and the necessary trash can. We brought in pizzas, cupcakes, and some other snacks. The kids had fun and we wrapped up and headed out once they started popping all the balloons.
My son and his friends enjoyed the room and party. It was a rare kid’s party where the parents can actually participate. The staff took care of all our needs and gracefully accommodated our rowdy crew of second graders. I would recommend this as a kids’ party destination, and I’d like to return without the kids to try the room again.
Great place with well themed escape rooms!  Derek was awesome!  Highly recommend The Launch!

We were staying in the downtown area while visiting family and always try and do an escape room wherever we're traveling to. Time to Escape definitely lives up to the great reviews - so much so that we decided to do two of the rooms in the same day! The Grand Zeppelin and The Launch were both phenomenal rooms - both in how well they were designed and decorated, and in how interactive, interesting, and infuriating (in a good way) all puzzles were! Jaryl was our in-room actor and our helpful robot arm for both rooms and made it so we had an absolute blast. The added element of playing a character in the room makes them even more fun.
Would definitely recommend Time to Escape for anyone who loves escape rooms or someone who's looking for a place to start - these rooms are some of the best we've ever played and we wish we had more time in town to do their other rooms!

name: SCAD FASH Museum of Fashion + Film
address: 1600 Peachtree Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: I'm so glad I visited the museum. It was my first time in Atlanta and first time at the museum. I really enjoyed the opportunity to check up close every little detail of beading, embroidery and intricate designs. The museum team is very friendly and knowledgeable, they provide lots of information on the exhibition pieces. The view of Atlanta was a nice surprise for me!

Outstanding Museum! An excellent place to see beautiful art ( collections of high end and unique fashion, sometimes photography exhibits) plus it is staffed with very knowledgeable staff and students that are accessible and answer questions.  A truly unique museum experience in a beautiful building.  Also probably the most inexpensive museum in Atlanta.

I went on the to SCAD FASH and took advantage of the free admission thanks to the Second Sunday museum program. I’m glad I went then because I would have been disappointed if I had paid to see one tiny exhibit. The Derrick Adams exhibit was neat, but I really wanted to see the Alaïa pieces and was disappointed that the grand opening for that was the next day. Visitors could pop their head into the Alaïa gallery, but it was still under construction. 

I will say that finding the parking garage was a headache, but once I was in, I was able to easily locate the entrance to the museum. The staff that was there that day were very friendly and helpful. I did love the views of Downtown Atlanta and the front of SCAD FASH is really unique. I would love to go again when the main exhibit is fully accessible to the public. 

FYI: they do not offer programs or details next to the individual pieces on exhibit. You must refer to their online guide or use one of the iPads they have available to visitors. I heard a few people grumbling about not knowing what they were looking at. Just ask one of the docents for help.

The muesum had a nice assortment of clothing. They had a lounge area that showcased  jewelry made by students and a varying selection of memorabilia for purchase. They also have a huge TV with a short video on it that displayed a assortment of SCAD's different talent from video to fashion and beyond. I would have like to seen a little more diversity in the video. The museum is small but filled with wonderful pieces and student helpers that are eager to help. Will be back to view different collections.

Interesting place to explore the multifaceted world of fashion. The exhibition 'Fashioning Art from Paper' is as disturbing as mesmerizing, and as a consequence, definitely a must-see. 
On the down notes, pedestrian access is rather bad and this museum appears slightly over reliant on smart devices (e.g., no description of the pieces but a kind invitation to access the virtual exhibition to know more).

name: Historic Fourth Ward Park
address: 680 Dallas St NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Fairly peaceful considering the highway nearby. Great place to let the dogs run around. The skate park looks well maintained. There are bathrooms on site as well as a playground. Also the beltline is right there for easy access. There's a decent amount of parking available.

Remembering this was once mostly a wooded area for trash dumping, HFWP is one of my favorite spots in ATL.

The design is layered and begs to be walked. Also, the steps facing the fountain make for a great reading/lunch spot. Word of caution, parking can be a true pain in the backside.

Good place for run/ walk, corporate/personal group events.
Dog Friendly.
Well maintained.

I moved to Atlanta nearly 10 years ago and I must say this area is totally different. Historic Fourth Ward Park is very nice. The playground is really nice for young children. There is a fountain and walking/bike paths. It's aesthetically appealing as well. A nice park tucked away in the city!
Love love LOVE this park always something to see and watch wildlife grow throughout the months and can't wait for the splash park ! It's definitely my favorite park for summertime !

name: Woodruff Park
address: 91 Peachtree St, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: "On a nice sunny day, I like taking a walk down town, just see👀what happening in neck of Atlanta. I meet different kind people, I sit some time and chill, read a book, watching the traffic go bye, or trying out some of their food in their many varieties of Restaurants down there😉." I go sometimes on the weekend, or sometimes on weekdays." I just enjoy getting out and enjoying what life have to Offer!"Try it Sometimes!" It's really Sues the Sole!🤗😎
This location has a public bathroom that is cleaned regularly and is a asset to this eye pleasure park. Food drinks good clean fun and entertainment
Rough wild..tho very convenient. With outlets on the poles down the path. It's a great field to lay and a great shade area to sit while being in a rural area near the bus stop and many food places.
They're a lot of homeless "blacks/Latinos" there, and I feel bad. I wish someone could bless them as much as I wish to. The park is beautiful. A place where you find art & reality at the same time.
Cool park where even adults have fun. Mark your stamp on this city, have fun, dont take things to seriously, and remember to smile while sliding 😉

name: Room Escape Atlanta
address: 306 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: The GREATEST escape room in Atlanta. The staff is awesome, our host Ronald will definitely have you intrigued in the activities they have to offer. He was a fantastic and phenomenal entertainer. I recommend if your in the area check it out you will not be disappointed by no means. Thanks Ronald for making our hooky day stress free your the best!!!!

Came here for my husband’s Birthday and we really enjoyed it. It was me, my husband, and our 3 kids. 

The Zombie in a Room was so good!  The guy who played Dr. Oxy did excellent. Having someone in the room added an extra feature that made it awesome. I’ve done multiple rooms but this was by far the best. 

We escaped the room but the zombie helped us out some. My 11 year old son had a few scary moments but by the end of the game, he was good. 

I really recommend the zombie in a room experience.

We went for a friends Birthday.  It was 6 of us and they added a couple to our group.  They meshed well with us. We ESCAPED the 80's.  It was sooooooo much fun.  Very challenging but we did it.  The orator was great too. He was pretty funny.  This place is highly recommended. I would love to go back and try the Criminal Minds Room.
Played The Lost Sense. Love the theme! The hints were a little unprompted at some times, but most definitely warranted at others. Gamemaster Alex had a real knack for their character!
Great escape room experience.  Staff is super helpful! We made it out with their help. Will definitely be back. They offer a few types of rooms.  Try the FBI theme.

name: Cascade Springs Nature Preserve
address: 2852 Cascade Rd SW, Atlanta, GA 30311, USA
reviews:
Nice easy hike with several different trails to coffee from.  We don't about 2 hours here in our way back from Florida to b Tennessee.  It made a nice break from the interstate.  
If it had bathrooms I think I might have given it 4 stars.  But between having no bathrooms and moderately poorly marked trails we give it 3.

I love this place. Very nice local trail. I take my son and his friends. Sometimes the dog! Once we begin our trek inside nearly everything around us becomes just quiet nature. Easy trail for any age. I even took my 80+ year old granmda! A few places to stop and take a rest along the way.

Cascade Nature Preserve is one of the best places to visit in Atlanta.  Thankfully, it is located not too far from my home.  I love going there to be out in nature and to find tranquility.  The preserve is well maintained and populated so you don't have to worry about any issues with people bothering you.

Gorgeous place! I arrived around 10 am and there were only a few people there but by the time I left (close to noon) the parking lot was full. It’s a great place to take a short decent hike and enjoy the beautiful waterfall and scenery.

I really did not enjoy this trail AT ALL. The trail was super short which was nice for a quick hike. However, it was a little creepy and dark. There was glass and trash which I wouldn’t mind much but had my pup with me. Also, there were various people leaving fruit offerings which left a weird smell. Alsoooo, a witches convent meets there which was kinda interesting/cool

name: Mission Escape Atlanta
address: 500 Bishop St NW E3, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: We definitely didn’t escape, but we had a lot of fun! Monty was an engaging gamemaster and walked us through some of what we missed when we lost. We tried the Hotel, and it was tough, but the splitting-up gimmick was too unique to pass up. We’d love to come back and try the Study room sometime!

My co-workers and I had a great time at Mission Escape. The staff was very friendly and helpful when we had a little trouble with the hotel scenario. This was my first experience with an escape room and I definitely enjoyed myself.

The venue seemed very nice, things seemed taken care of and clean.
Loved the room and staff!  So convenient to midtown and can't wait to come back

My boyfriend and I had a great time yesterday for our escape room experience on his birthday. The couple we were with had a birthday Guy also so that was fun working with them as well. Samantha was very helpful throughout from before the game until the end. I would definitely recommend this place and they were in a location that we didn’t have to pay additional for parking which was an absolute plus

The beginning of the mission was great.
Had a lot of clues except the golf ball part. It shouldn't be in the game. 
Ending was short and kind of uneventful.
For the amount of people, the rooms are too small.
8 people is just too much and the price they charge they really don't put into the effort of the clues or the set up of anything. 

They also spam you with reviews until you unsubscribe or block them.

name: The Woodruff Arts Center
address: 1280 Peachtree St NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: What an amazing venue. There really isn't a bad seat in the house and the acoustics are spot on. The staff are very helpful from buying a glass of wine or a bottle of water to helping you find your seat or giving directions to the restroom. The entire place is very clean including restrooms. The area to mingle before and after a performance is large enough to accommodate everyone without the feeling of being squished in somewhere. Hang on to your person after the show though as it's easy to lose someone in the crowd as everyone is leaving. Concerts, plays and ballet's are always perfectly run. The perfect place for some cultural entertainment for the whole family. Wheelchair accessible.

Home to Symphony Hall, Alliance Theatre, and the High Museum of Art, which are all wonderful. The center is very pleasing to the eye and really stands out. There is an upscale restaurant on campus and a nice plaza at the center of everything, which often has some kind of art installation. Parking seems to fill up fast in the deck below the facility but there is another deck nearby and street parking if you're lucky.

I go to this venue constantly, and it is truly wonderful. Excellent design and a spacious lobby equipped with high class food service. The orchestra, chorus, and theatre themselves are very skilled, and the hall is a beautiful space. The hall itself could definitely use more aisles, as I constantly have to deal with people sliding past me to get to the middle, however this is merely a minor annoyance, which is balanced out by the quality of the orchestra and the sound in the hall.

I really enjoyed my visit here. I would suggest ordering tickets online and going straight to will call when you get there but even if you dont the cashiers work efficiently enough to get the lines down quickly. The museum is huge so wear walking shoes. I loved the European art section. I recommend this for a family outing if you can find the time. Second Sundays are free I believe.

I've come here on quite a few occasions but mostly for the symphony orchestra. They play amazingly it's just the people with me often fall asleep until the fast dramatic music plays. I guess the tones were too soothing because they dont even fall asleep with sleeping pills.😂

name: Paranoia Quest Escape the room
address: 72 Broad St SW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: Dominique was amazing! I love her acting and accents for the different roles she’s played. She was super positive and made it an enjoyable experience. It sucks she was the only one handling this location though, especially at night. But the room was really tough. I’d definitely go again :)

We took our company on an outing for National Intern Day and participated in Operation Bravo. TJ was our guide and he was EXCELLENT! Loved this and was a fun activity for a small company to celebrate our intern.

Scheduled The Escape Plan for our board of directors and they LOVED it.  The experience was great for the entire group and demonstrated their ability to work as a team.
