The detail put into the design made it incredibly immersive and the theme was perfect for a corporate outing.  While the puzzles were difficult, they never reached the point of frustration.  10/10.  I can't wait to experience the other adventures!

If you’re looking for a fun escape room, this is the one! We did the Murder Mystery and let me tell you, my brain hurt. Lol there was only 2 of us but we figured it out! The girl who worked there was SO GREAT. She was really nice and gave us awesome tips and clues. Our experience was 10/10. Highly recommend.

We had a great time doing the Zombie Apocalypse escape yesterday for my sister’s birthday. Cat was awesome!! We made it out with less than 2 minutes to spare. I was mostly impressed with the quality of the set and props in the “lab” and the difficulty of the challenges. It was a great time. Be prepared to think, just don’t overthink. :) Thanks Cat!

name: Jackson Street Bridge
address: Jackson St NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews: Coming to this location for the first time was amazing. There is limited parking to go to this location but it is an amazing view and an amazing spot to take pictures. My suggestion is to stay aware of your surroundings when you come to this location just to stay safe. But other than that, one of the best places to take picture and specially at night. AMAZING!

Better visit this bridge on a Sunday to avoid hordes. Best to visit at 3 PM when there is ample sunlight on the downtown buildings. Park your car for free at Martin Luther Jr memorial for free 3 blocks away. Take best shots of the buildings and recreate that walking dead scene sans the zombie hordes and rusting cars. Watch out for human zombies glued to their smartphones though.

Jackson Street Bridge was a really cool place to go too! The overlook is quite cool to see and was worth the walk. I enjoyed seeing the skyline and it's probably even better at night but still a cool place to see a long the way.
Super cool spot in Atlanta to bring a date! Any time of day is great, I personally enjoy the nighttime skyline!

Not quite sure this is as “awesome” a place to take night photos as some have proclaimed due to lens flares and localized street lighting, but it certainly is an iconic view of the city’s landscape. A great place for the unique family/friend/loved one photo opp as well as those wanting to make a selfie statement. Limited street parking near Jackson bridge but found Cain st. in Freedom park, across street from bridge, is ideal parking with minimal walk. Would recommend this to anyone visiting to ATL to appreciate the architecture of downtown Atlanta.

name: Time to Escape: The Escape Room Experience (Brookhaven)
address: 1441 Dresden Dr #230, Atlanta, GA 30319, USA
reviews:
Once again, It's Time to Escape impressed us with their game master.  This time it was Skylar who really got into the role and was exceedingly helpful.  Having done all the rooms at both this venue and downtown Atlanta, we were excited to find out a new room had been opened since our April 2019 visit.  

This was a different kind of room - we had to escape but as soon as we finished the last part which was to blow the vault, we only had 2.5 minutes to finish the room even though we still had seven minutes on the clock.  The last minutes are used to collect as much lot as possible and the more, the higher the final score.  

The plot is that you're a Pinkerton Detective with a mission to bring down the Wild Bunch gang by infiltrating them and stealing their gold, silver, jewels and cash.  There were some very interesting puzzles and for the second day in a row, the need to figure out a dance (yesterday was Le Feu with dance moves on stage needing to be figured out).  Team 93 (that's us) totally sucks at dance moves but luckily, our great Game Master Skylar helped us through it.  

The room's tech was somewhat strange.  Don't know how much was "real" and how much was GM controlled.  There were enough things going on to indicate a high level of GM hand-holding required. 

This was not my favorite It's Time to Escape room but it's pretty good with some very novel puzzles and an interesting finish.  "Blowing" the vault door was fun!

My friends and I LOVE escape rooms and we go to them pretty often. Yesterday, we went to Time to Escape for the first time and I don’t have a single complaint about the experience.  From the production value to the level of enthusiasm and fun put into the adventure by our gamemaster Ben, to the way the game played out, everything was top quality. We did the Alcatraz themed room and the clues and puzzles were varied and linear and I felt there was something for everyone on our team to feel like they had participated and had a chance to triumph and get us to our next step. We are already planning to come back very soon and try another room. Cannot recommend this place enough!

We went for my daughter's birthday. Her and her friends had a blast and Ben was such a great host. All around great experience. Very reasonable pricing (call ahead and secure the party room). And even though we didn't escape (King Tut's tomb), the kids had a lot of fun.

Overall; I had fun. We did the Al Capone story and I enjoyed that we were assigned different characters to play with abilities and a side quest. With that said I thought the characters were a distraction from completing the main goal. It's a tough mix. Maybe I didn't play my role correctly, who knows. The bartender, James, was awesome and really did his best to give us a good experience. Nobody beats Donnie on a bet.

The Al Capone room was such a fun experience! We got assigned cards with different characters and each one had a special ability and side quest, which took the room to a whole different level since everybody got super into character. There was also an actor in the room (Alex - he was awesome!) who interacted with us as well and helped build the experience and helped us with clues. He never broke character and made the experience way more exciting and fun. I highly recommend this place and special thanks to Alex for helping us have a great evening!

name: Apex Museum
address: 135 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews:
The APEX Museum is a great museum to view black history and the history of black people and business all along Sweet Auburn.

The admission price is very reasonable and the exhibits are expertly done. The replicas are great in my opinion.

Finally, there is a hall of black inventors and their inventions, along with an exhibit of black women in STEM.

The best museum for African culture. They take you all the way back to Egypt as our history did not begin with slavery. There's so much information here, you can hardly take it all in with one visit. Very powerful!

Great museum on black culture! I had the pleasure of discovering this little gem through one of the  colleges that I do editorial work for that had students coming through for a road trip. Definitely worth a stop. They had a really great collection of woman in science that the students found to be a fresh breath of air as well!
Had a good time exploring the Museum and enjoyed the night's event for Black History. We should support this Museum year round. Host your events here and learn some things at the same time.

I stopped in here when when in Downtown. APEX Museum offers a refined, accurate insight into African history before, during and after the transatlantic slave trade. If you know nothing about African and African American history and culture, you will learn plenty. The two films shown provide an interesting reflection on Auburn Avenue. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. The gift counter has some fantastic post cards. The owner has a grand vision for the future of APEX, once realised the space will be phenomenal.

name: Six Flags Over Georgia
address: 275 Riverside Pkwy, Austell, GA 30168, USA
reviews:
My two son's and I are really excited about our next family vacation. 
We are now planning to visit the most amazing amusement park on the planet, for spring break. 
Six Flags over Georgia has the best rides and the best food.

Six Flags is by far my favorite amusement park in the state of Georgia, but when you travel as much as I do you begin to see it's not perfect. Going to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure in Florida, or Disneyland in California is an entirely different experience due to the themes of each ride, and the variety of rides available. At Six Flags over Georgia it's all about the roller coasters, which is great for me: a thrill-seeker, but a somewhat miserable experience for many of my friends who have motion sickness, sensitive stomachs, and the like. Don't get me wrong, there's something for everyone at Six Flags, but I will say the park itself caters to a specific niche more than any other I've personally visited. 

As far as I'm aware there are only two dark rides, two water rides, one drop-style ride, and one pendulum: the new Pandemonium. Other than the various similar swing rides scattered throughout the park and the family rides like the carousel and bumper cars, the remaining roster is all roller coasters. If not for Hurricane Harbor which is only open during the warmer months of course, and seasonal events like Fright Fest and Holiday in the Park which we make it a point to attend every year (which are consistently good for the record), Six Flags in general could get pretty old pretty fast for someone who isn't a fan of thrill rides.

Luckily, this sentiment doesn't apply to me. Having grown up in Georgia Six Flags was always my go-to destination for birthday parties once I was tall enough to ride anything I wanted, but being older now, I am constantly around a significant other and friends who are not used to such experiences, and I wish Six Flags had more to offer that we could all enjoy together. I don't mean overpriced carnival games either, although all of us can at least enjoy the overpriced food together! Overall Six Flags is a must for anyone with kids, or anyone who enjoys thrill rides (and not much else). A season's pass and dining pass are well worth the cost if you plan on coming at least twice a year. Even if none of this applies to you, stop by for Holiday in the Park and Fright Fest for the change in scenery: that alone is worth the cost of admission!

Sad disheveled little park. Memories are the best thing I can say about this amusement park. It needs a serious renovation and the cost for everything from a tiny $10 funnel cake to $25 parking is too expensive for the average family. The lines are crazy long, half the rides weren't working, the shows are so sad. The rides were very dated and didn't have the in-line experiences they used to have, boring long lines to ride for 30 seconds. I couldn't even find cotton candy. Seriously? I went for roller coasters and cotton candy and only managed to get in one ride for the afternoon. The few hours there cost approximately $110 to simply walk around trying to find a roller coaster with under an hour wait time and pay a lot of money to do nothing. If they wanted to get more money for food and merchandise, they should make it more affordable and people would buy more. I have been going here for over 40 years and always loved Six Flags, especially the coasters. The memories will always be great though.

We signed up for the diamond membership and highest dining pass. Paid for itself in first day. 6.35 for meal plan per month and today we would have spent 34.00 for food and 30.00 for unlimited drinks so it paid for a whole year in one day. The staff were all pretty friendly, the park was clean except the restrooms could use more attention. Overall, I'm excited for the year ahead and can't wait to use the diamond membership to reserve seats at the water park in the summer... Also, free preferred parking with the diamond membership so it saves 25.00 per visit...

One of the most excitement amusement park I ever went to. With lots of thrilled rides to beautifully scenarios around, this is the best six flags of USA. I liked their application which never let me lost and tells me up-to-date information about the park. The Superman was on of my favorite. Highly recommend everyone to go there. 5 stars. Cheers.

name: Decatur Square
address: 509 N McDonough St, Decatur, GA 30030, USA
reviews: What a very cool area - a gazebo- gorgeous planters filled artistically planted annual plants-  surrounded by shops and great people watching.  Highly recommend stopping here.  And a great way to disguise a meteor station!
Downtown Decatur always makes me feel whimsical. It’s a great walk and the fact that Starbucks is so easily accessible, it gets my vote

There are tons of places to shop around here as well as just sitting and relaxing. They will often host events like music festivals at this location as well! If you live around the area, are visiting, or are even 45 miles away looking for something new to do this weekend I’d strongly suggest visiting here.

Super cute collection of restaurants and stores. There is something for everyone here including a bar, sushi, Mexican food, ice cream, a corner store and more. 

Normally you will need to pay for parking and keep in mind there is a homeless population in the area so you may see quite a bit of homeless people. If that doesn’t bother you, then rock on. 

There are also a few nice places to take pics over here.

Decatur Square is is nice place to visit and spend an afternoon. It sits right next to the Decatur Marta Station. There are several places to eat and a variety of Statute's and Monuments to look at. It is great.

name: Historic Ebenezer Baptist Church
address: 407 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews:
I have visited the Historic Ebenezer Baptist Church on several occasions over the years.  I highly recommend everyone take the opportunity to visit this site should you be in the Atlanta area.  There is no cost of entry or to park; I have always been able to find a parking spot close by.
On one occasion we were able to sit in on a live presentation by one of the Park Rangers who attended Ebenezer Baptist at the same time as Dr King.  This was, by far, our most memorable visit.  On our most recent visit, however, the ranger informed us that such presentations no longer take place.  
It is incredibly inspirational to be in the very church where Dr Martin Luther King, Jr grew up and preached.  Dr King’s message of unity and peace is clearly demonstrated in the church and park on the same grounds.
The only criticism I have is I have encountered several other visitors who have been much less than friendly.  It seems Dr King’s message of love and acceptance are not necessarily ascribed to by everyone who visits.  
All said, this site is a MUST VISIT!

There was a sermon being played  and if you closed your eyes you could visualize Dr. Martin Luther King  at the pulpit. It was a great sermon and it was uplifting and the song that followed was Use Me Lord so your spiritual being was totally filled .  It was also great to see so many family reunions visiting the site. You saw red, green ,white, black,  and blue shirts with at least 25 people in each group.   It was awesome.

Historical Treasure that I am thankful to have visited in my lifetime! A lot of Great Leaders entered through those doors and made some amazing changes that we will always be thankful for! This experience was remarkable and was a pleasure to visit. Friendly & Informative Tour Guides on site! Free and I believe it is an experience for all ages to enjoy!
Another must visit important landmark in civil rights history - a close walk from the Martin Luther King Jr National Historical Park.
Great experience! I'm glad I was able to experience it. I loved how they played one of King's sermons while u sat in the pews.

name: Smith Family Farm at Atlanta History Center
address: 130 West Paces Ferry Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: A very interesting look into a bygone era. Extremely kid friendly.  Almost everything is allowed to be touched (period clothing, furniture, household items, etc.).  Goats, sheep and chickens present.  Only about 2-3 minutes stroll from the main building. Staffed by very friendly volunteers who can tell you more about what you're seeing.

I wish I lived in Atlanta so I could volunteer here. Fantastic farm house with docents were very helpful in explaining the different parts of the house and how it was used by the family. Also covering how it had changed over the years. The kitchen building frequently has demonstrations. Even when there is no one there the collection of hearth cooking implements is quite extensive. The slave quarters were fine with explanatory panels. The goats, chickens, turkeys were great to see as was the barn and blacksmith shop and wood working equipment area. You really felt like you went back in time.

Cool little farm and historic center in Atlanta.  Worth stopping by to see the "old" houses and buildings.  Plus the farm animals and exhibits.  Gives you a small idea of what life in rural Georgia used to be like.  Plus what life in general used to be like on a farm in the US.  Surprising to find something like this in a well populated residential area.  Easy to find and get to with plenty of parking.
Pre civil war era family farm. Nice job assembling and restoring the buildings. There were guides to answer questions when we visited.

Get in touch with the past for perspective. Learn about Atlanta's history, the importance of the Battle of Atlanta, and this very painting -- and our collective memory of what really happened in 1864 and 1865 to shape this great Nation.

name: The Wren's Nest House Museum
address: 1050 Ralph David Abernathy Blvd, Atlanta, GA 30310, USA
reviews:
Yes, you are at the right spot. No, this is not somebody's random family reunion 🤣🤣

We had a wonderful time here when the West End put on one of their candle light concerts with Eric Roberson performing. Walking into the Wren's Nest back yard really does look like your going to the cook-out at the family reunion, but that's all part of the charm. There is such a homey vibe here. I felt like I found a piece of true (old) Atlanta. I will definitely be back.

We went here for the Poe Experience but instructions were unclear and we missed part of the skits because of it. Although the actors were decent the writing could have used some work and the ad-lib didn't live up to expectations. It is fun for the atmosphere but the cost was too much for what we got.

I had a damn great time watching live jazz bands perform. Especially my favorite singer and actress Chandra Currelley from the movie Diary of A Mad Black Woman. Y'all don't know what y'all missed! I had a blast! Atlanta knows how to party!!!💖💯

Attended the 105th annual holiday party. It was a great mix of history, music, storytelling etc. You will learn so much about the history of Joel Chandler Harris, author of the Uncle Remus tales. Much misaligned during recent years, his tales were actually quite instrumental in forging new ground in familiarizing cultures with each other in the post Civil War era. Google maps WILL NOT take you into the parking lot. Coming down Lowery into West End the driveway is immediately after the house. Basically when you see St Anthony of Padua's church on the left the house is half a block down on the left. It has a small parking area that is mostly dirt/grass. Keep this in mind in inclement weather!
Perfect for the theme I will be decorating for! Love the old time feel! I have definitely found a gem

name: Callanwolde Fine Arts Center
address: 980 Briarcliff Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA
reviews: What lovely gardens and location. Such a gem for us to have here. I especially enjoy attending weddings hosted here.

Such a unique, gorgeous venue.  So happy we had our wedding here! Beautiful traditional setting but still plenty of space for everyone to move around. Also loved that there were plenty of great photo spots for ourselves and our guests.
Such a lovely place and space.  I love the ballroom.  Great for events.  DeKalb County is the host of its ownership.
Been there for Art gallery.  Nice space. Clean bathrooms. Beautifully done grounds.

I had never painted in my life. The Korian teacher was terrific. My class was small, however it was comprised of some very talented artists and myself. I truly enjoyed this adventure seeing what I could accomplish and watching the talented students create magnificent pieces of artwork

name: Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Jesus
address: 353 Peachtree St NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Great church.  Lots of visitors pass through and the staff and father are very accommodating.  Location is right off freeway and is located very close to center of atlanta.  Church validates parking for church goers.  Security guard on site is friendly and has been working at church more than 15 years.  2 bathrooms for parish use.  Beautiful building outside and in, currently trying to fund money to repair the church spires it seems.  The stainglass is beautiful as well.

Free coffee and a snack lunch on Thursdays. Starts at 8:00 AM, sack lunch to go at 8:45. Amazing folks with the hearts of our Lord Jesus. Come on by for some fellowship and make some friends. All are welcome, come as you are. Come to the small parking area on the side of the church. Door is by the water fountain and historical garden.

Joined this parish to participate in Veneration on Good Friday. The church is absolutely beautiful. Parking was too it's right behind the Parish and was validated upon conclusion of mass. The choir made made that much more special. The accapella  hymns, the violin, guitar and piano were just so special. My daughter and I were visiting for the night and felt right at home. Happy Easter and thank you for making such a solemn day so special and memorable.
Excellent place for finding Jesus. Always there. Noon Mass at noon Monday to Friday.
It's a very beautiful church. People are friendly. The priest was really good with the word. Love it. Definitely will go back. 🙏🙏🙏

name: Bodies The Exhibition
address: 1381 Market St NW, Atlanta, GA 30363, USA
reviews: Educational and interesting. I'm a registered nurse and to see this stuff made a lot more of my education "click". I really wish photos could have been taken but since the bodies are human and have been donated, I understand about respecting the deceased.

The idea behind the museum is pretty fascinating, but they have a relatively small collection with basic information geared towards the more casual learner. Some might also express ethical concerns over visiting, because the bodies and parts displayed are real. But, it can be a great way to introduce high school kids to human anatomy.

The guide was very informative and friendly.  I came a year ago from VA to visiting my daughter in GA. He was very kind to my one of my daughters going to school for nursing. When I returned this year, his pleasant demeanor had not changed when he discussed the exhibit with my youngest daughter in school to be a pediatrician . I really enjoyed seeing and getting knowledge on God's awesome creation... our bodies!

Fantastic! We bring our massage therapy students here every year, and this was the best year yet. They have new interactive stations that really help to engage the students. The guides we had were awesome; highly knowledgeable and friendly. I highly recommend!

If you're into science and Anatomy you'll love the exhibit. The body's are real so you cant photograph or touch them, but they do have new interactive pieces that you can touch. It's really cool experience.

name: Hammonds House Museum
address: 503 Peeples St SW, Atlanta, GA 30310, USA
reviews: The Carrie Mae Weems: “From Here I Saw What Happened and I Cried” exhibit was elegant. Amazing museum.
Restored Historic Home in West End, nice orginal details.
House has beautiful bones but does need some renovation inside and out.
I love this place for its continuous efforts to preserve African American art and artifacts.
A wonderful treasure in West End Atlanta. Historic Victorian home which has featured artwork by many talented artists. Friendly staff. Conveniently located. Parking available.

name: Cabbagetown Park
address: 701 Kirkwood Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30316, USA
reviews: Beautiful, clean, and well-kept. Decent playground. Wish there were more shade/tree cover.
Old Atlanta at its absolute finest! Brought back so many wonderful memories for my wife and I during grad school.

Cool neighborhood park - perfect for a quiet afternoon of reading or chilling with kids/dogs. The sitting area under the big tree is very shaded for those hot days. Walk over to Sweet Cheats for coffee and something sweet.
Hidden gem. Super friendly people. Great during the summer work regular events.

This place is the definition of a neighborhood park. It's got a playground and large field for activities. Theres also a really good tree with large branches that's perfect for climbing. You see a lot of families here in the evenings and on weekends.

name: Noguchi Playscape
address: Active Oval Loop, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: This is one of the most unique playgrounds anywhere.  If you are an architecture and design nerd you will want to visit this site.  It's the only playground built by him during his lifetime.
This perfect playground deserves more than five stars!
Atlanta is so lucky to have original designed work by famed architect, designer, Isamu Noguchi. My children love playing there. At the entrance of Piedmont Park.
This is a cool playground but be sure to watch your small toddlers as some of the elements are not as "child proof" as newer playgrounds.
Great playground for the kids! Love the modern art of Isamu Noguchi.

name: Piedmont Dog Park
address: Park Dr NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: Very good size for both large and small dogs.  We stayed in the small dog side because one of my dogs is scared of large dogs.  Really enjoyed the size of the small dog side and i liked the mulch on the ground,  i was originally afraid that it was dirt but was presently surprised. Definitely coming back abed would highly recommend.

Loved visiting this dog park! We currently live in Columbus and the dog parks here are severely lacking. It was well-worth the drive to give my babies some well-deserved play time and socialization! Nobody seemed too uppity there either, which was a relief as I have a very vocal large dog who is often mistaken for being aggressive. It seemed like most of the people in the park were accustomed to dog interactions and body language so they understood that she wasn't being mean. There was a reasonable amount of shade and nice rocks to sit on. Decent size as well. Overall very pleasant experience.

Large dog park in beautiful piedmont park. Owners are friendly and responsible but the real attraction of course are the doggos, the park is well maintained and kept clean, nice place to let the dogs out.

We love letting our dog play here. She's got a lot of energy she needs to let out. The other dog parents are very attentive to their dogs and make sure they're behaving. It's a fairly big space for some full speed zoomies.

Favorite dog park. My dog is a corgi, which is medium size. He usually plays in small dog park. Every dog and their owner are friendly. Great place for dogs to socialize. PS: parking is not cheap, $2 for an hour. but close to dog park, about 3-min walk.

name: Freedom Park
address: Moreland Ave NE & North Avenue NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: So much you don't know about president Carter. Wonderful Man first. Awesome President. Still doing good work. Must visit. Enjoyed it so much I will go again.
We really enjoyed our visit to the Jimmy Carter's Presidential Library. It is very well presented and quite interesting. The full size replica of the Oval Office was my favorite part.
It was closing a bit early but there was still a nice array of gods for sale - veggies, fruit, coffee, honey, bitters, teas, mushrooms, and a bunch more. Friendly market like Grant Park but smaller.

I went on a Sunday afternoon and it was nice and quiet. There were a few people biking or walking on the trail. The trail is nice and there are sculptures along it. There’s plenty of open space to play lawn games or throw a ball/frisbee around.
A real treasure for the city. The Carter Center makes it extra special.

name: Underground Atlanta
address: 50 Upper Alabama St, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: There is free parking after 7:00pm off the street around the nearby blocks. The Masquerade is currently the most exciting thing happening to Underground Atlanta. I wish there were small games around Kenny's Alley to play for in between bands. A pass to go from Heaven, Hell, and Purgatory would also be a fantastic move from the Masquerade. I don't know if it's legally possible though.

The Mascarade Venue is pretty good but everything else appeared run down or closed except for a hand full of places. The Subway was open but had no working bathroom which is disgusting. I will go back for concerts at the venue but if you are looking for anything else to do here forget about it.

Been there for 2 concerts at Masquerade.  I really prefer heaven to hell because of the amount of space. Like the amount of people that were crammed into the concert  at Masquerade Hell had it so hot in there, but it was still a good time no the less.

Probably one of my best study spots yet! I can really appreciate a coffee shop that goes out of its way to provide a great experience for its customers, not only in terms of the beverages but space and facilities as well. WiFi is great, noise levels are low, and prices are fair.

Well, I didn't die. I felt like the possibility was pretty high though. There is absolutely no reason to be here other than to go to The Masquerade. Other that, the area is sketchy and extremely dangerous at night. So, that's gonna be a no from me.

name: Trap Music Museum
address: 630 Travis St NW, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: I enjoyed the museum. It was a little too crowded inside.  I was unable to get the full effect of the museum because people were holding up areas  Of the museum for several minutes just to take pictures. It would be nice if they had security to keep traffic flowing throughout the sections in order for everyone to enjoy the museum. It's a nice vibe! And the staff were very entertaining. I will most definitely visit again, but probably during the week day so it will be less crowded

It was smaller than I expected, but I thoroughly enjoyed all of the exhibits that they had to offer. They are very realistic and they give you an in-depth experience of life growing up in the trap, and of living a life of fame and stardom. Anyone eager to learn a little more about the dark underbelly of trap house and hip hop culture in the south will be exceptionally satisfied.

This museum was a great experience as a tourist. Lots photo ops, has a bar, music, dancing interesting TRAP decor. I would say it’s more of a fun activity rather than a historical educative museum. Most of the attendees are also dressed up festively so also fun to people watch and make friends.

All the way from Chicago, my sister took me here for a visit. When we walked in, immediately had a flash back of familiar territory. The way the living room was set up with granny sitting on the couch and "Martin " playing on the TV was a great concept. I think they did a great job with the gallery for the targeted audience! The staff was great and the atmosphere was a good vibe. Also kudos for Not hiking up the entry price just because this is a tourist spot! They had their "targeted audience" in mind it seems. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the parking setup and the long lines outdoors.

Anyone who know the culture will have an appreciation for this museum.  It’s a must see when visiting Atlanta GA.  They have captivated the journey some of your favorite rappers have gone through to get to where they are today and there is a lot of history in the artwork. It’s an experience like no other. The staff is very knowledgeable and fun. S/O to Brandon for the tour.

name: Millennium Gate Museum
address: 395 17th St NW, Atlanta, GA 30363, USA
reviews: Absolute hidden gem in Atlanta. Was shocked when we first drove past it.... I thought I had some how flown over to Europe again. Made a point of stopping close by and taking a walk through the park and time to enjoy the museum and surrounding areas. Amazed at how few people were enjoying the wonder open areas and sites of their own city.... need more places like this.

Been by this arch structure at Atlantic Station countless times before finding out there's a history museum in there. Definitely worth going at least once. The guy working when we were there was super knowledgeable and very friendly.

It's a short walk from the Atlantic Station shopping complex/mall or whatever its called. It says they have a museum but it's closed late. I didnt get to see it but the gate is an engineering masterpiece. Ample lighting at night so it's still nice to take photos late.
The staff was really nice, forgot his name but was super knowledgeable about Georgia history. Took us up to the roof and gave us a lot of cool facts.
Had so much fun here, there's some really neat things and it's cheap!!

name: Constitution Lakes
address: 1305 S River Industrial Blvd SE, Atlanta, GA 30315, USA
reviews:
We visited the Doll’s Head Trail at Constitution Lakes Park in Atlanta today. This is definitely an ultra-unique experience, a short hike through displays of bricks, toys, and tiles found at the park. The trail winds through the forest and explores collections of found objects, washed from the banks of the nearby South River, now artfully and whimsically arranged in displays of folk art and culture.

Now an urban nature preserve, this park was once the site of a 19th-century brick company that excavated Georgia’s famous red clay. The excavation pits, now filled with water, comprise the Constitution Lakes. This trail explores nature habitats on the two lakes via long boardwalks, and a variety of creative, weird, and sometimes creepy works of art. We had such a fun time checking this place out!
A great park for an interesting hike in Atlanta. The landscape itself is interesting, but the highlight is Doll's Head trail which doesn't disappoint in create a quirky and eerie experience.

Nice inner city park and the entrance to the Dolls head trail.  Park has a great 6’ wide concrete path.  Lake is a little low and stagnant, but still nice. If you want to go to the dolls head trail follow the path all the way to the end. The Dolls head trail is an art project where they have picked up trash in the park and made art out of it. The trail is a relaxing walk of about 2 miles round trip from the parking lot.
A nice little hidden gem for a short hike. Doll's Head Trail is only a portion of the park. Be sure to see the whole area. There are boardwalks,  wetland areas, and serene views.
I love the view of the lakes. I wish pass a certain point the walking path was more walking friendly for people. It's beautiful & not far of a walk to the lake.

name: The King Center
address: 449 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews: It was great to see Dr. King’s legacy continue. I respect his unorthodox and radical way to reach people. I think that the similar narrative to Dr. King’s movement and that of Jesus is that when individuals want to spread unconditional love it never ends well for that person. Obviously, there are a few differences between these two, Jesus being God in the flesh which is being completely God. However, Dr. King was definitely a saint and was doing God’s work.

Museum to go along with the MLK National Park/Visitor Center.  MLK Jr. is buried outside of the Center.  There are some exhibits inside and definitely work go there if you have the time.  Again, nothing overwhelming but very solid and worth the time.

Still great place to visit and share history 
Constant improvements, seems every visitor that come to town to visit i bring them here...I am still in awe each time i sit in the original Church, the presenceof the Lord is here. Kudos to the Park service, they are very helpful, professional and do a great job.

This is truly one of those places that will leave you speechless. The King Center is a very moving and eye opening experience. You cannot put into words what MLK accomplished during the 60's. He was truly ahead of his time.  You will need at least 2-3 hours to fully take in the entire complex. A must do when you are in downtown Atlanta.

It was an honor to be able to visit on MLK weekend. Visiting all the areas literally gave me the chills. I'll be coming back because I didn't get to tour his birth home or the original Ebenezer Baptist Church.

name: Chastain Memorial Park
address: 140 Chastain Park Ave NW, Atlanta, GA 30342, USA
reviews: Absolutely loved it. Such a quiet and exhilarating place. Lot fun for the kids too. Some monumental trees, golf courses, walking trails, definitely worth a visit.
Nice place. Like playground and stables there. I wish parking near playground was a bit simpler.
This place takes the title for my favorite park in Georgia. Amazing place for kids, could've spent the entire day here!
We were there for Australia Pink Floyd.  It was great.  The crowd was great.  They allow the people to bring their own refreshments.  The sound system was very good.  Wonderful experience.
What a wonderful path. About three miles, well paved and clean. Our daughter is not old enough to use the playground yet but they are pretty extensive, look fun and well kept.

name: Blue Heron Nature Preserve
address: 4055 Roswell Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30342, USA
reviews:
Pretty cool place tucked in the city.  Our beautiful neighbor passed away and his family had a gathering there to honor him. 

After I left, I went through that moment of what you just experienced - no matter what it is - a movie, concert, event - when it sinks in and you experience the afterglow - for lack of better terminology.

I felt guilty because we were there to miss somebody and grieve and shed tears... And there was very little of that.  It was happy and light-hearted and a beautiful tribute for a beautiful person.  And I think it was because we were surrounded by the peace of nature - tucked in the hustle and bustle of Atlanta.  

If you feel the call of the mountains, or stressed out, or don't know what to do with yourself... And there is no time for a drive away, take a drive here.  Find a rock or a log, zone out, and clear the mind.  

Then drive your 15 minutes back home...  Thank you Blue Heron supporters for what you've done to carve out nature in our city.
Nice little trail that now connects to the larger trails in the area. Be sure to check out the box turtle enclosure near the school.  Very nice volunteers,  too

Small nature park in the busy part of the city. You feel you’re in wild for few mins. It has a 20 min trail. Note that the trail is narrow for most part. Good for a quick walk. It has a community garden worth spending some time here.

I came to get information about volunteering with blue heron but got distracted by the park's beauty.  I had to walk a part of the trail while i was here. So beautiful.  Can't wait til it's hotter outside.. want to come back and explore and take it all in
Nice small park with a hidden waterfall that's little known by the locals.

name: Canoe
address: 4199 Paces Ferry Rd SE, Atlanta, GA 30339, USA
reviews: Canoe is now the best restaurant that we have visited so far. From the moment we made our reservations to the moment we left, everyone exemplified excellent customer service and you could see they cared about their customers. The menu were special to our anniversary, the food was delicious and Sierra did an amazing job as our server. The supervisor came over when we didn't like the first appetizer, which was no fault of anyone working there as we didn't know what we were ordering, and brought our second one out in less than 2 minutes. They made us feel very welcomed and we will definitely be back again. Even the secondary waiter who picked up our silverware was amazing as well. If you're ever in town looking for a great place to attend, stop by the Canoe!

We had a wonderful birthday dinner celebration for my brothers! Brian was the best great recommendation for cocktails. appetizers, entree and dessert! Super helpful and everything was great! We had crab cake, smoked salmon, octopus and calamari all were fantastic! The entrees we had were NY Strip, Pasta, Rabbit- oh my so so good and the sides were perfect and the special was Snapper so delicious! Did I mention the breads too good, my favorite was flatbread with the perfect hint of heat and for dessert the popcorn ice cream sundae- caramel popcorn, ice cream and caramel who knew? Brian really made us feel special, but everyone very welcoming from valet to hostess and all who helped to make our night such a treat!! We’ll be back

Kudos to our server Justin!!! He served with excellence!! The Canoe Atlanta! Delicious Food, Excellent Service, Great Ambiance!! 
This was my first visit to Canoe!! I’ve listened to my daughter and son in law rave about this restaurant for over a year now. I knew I would be visiting from out of town for her birthday and knew this would have been the perfect place to celebrate her birthday!! 
The Canoe did not disappoint! I will definitely be visiting again

The ambiance of the restaurant was perfect, dimmed lighting and the outdoor bar near the river was on point, the kangaroo and blueberry granola concoction was to die for! Service was impeccable - our server was very hospitable and paid very close attention to all details. This was truly an experience and I would consider my top 5 restaurants in Atlanta :)

Canoe combines modern atmosphere with a natural feel. The location on the river is perfect and my friends and I had so much fun taking pictures in the gardens. The food and service were both fantastic. We arrived thirty minutes before our reservation but had to wait on one more person. They allowed us to get a table ahead of schedule and the server was more than patient. It was the perfect place for a brunch with friends.

name: Aria
address: 490 East Paces Ferry Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: What an Amazing Place! Everything we had from the menu was A++++. I would honestly give this place more than 5 stars if I could. Robert our waiter was the best. Thank You Aria for making our 1 year Anniversary unforgettable 👌

Aria is one of these locations about which one can't speak without excitement and somewhat trepidation. First of all this awesome Aria has anything to do with that sushi chain like known in Chicago and few other places. This place is absolutely authentic,  food is inventive,  very memorable,  wine selection is superb. The champagne selection is a symphony. 
Every time we spend a night here it's a time of pure pleasure. In my opinion this restaurant would greatly benefit from life violin or Spanish guitar player. The place is justifiably expensive.

We had the set menu and it was one of the finest we have had. The wine pairing was perfect, quantity just sufficient enough that you can actually enjoy all the courses. All the dishes very unique and presented in a very appealing way. For such a fancy high end restaurant, the service was remarkable amazing and staff extremely friendly, a rare thing these days. Overall I highly recommend this place, especially their lobster tail.

This is definitely the best restaurant in Atlanta to celebrate any occasion. The food and the service are perfect. Every time I went there, the servers were so attentive to my needs. They have the best scallops with decent prices for their food. Highly recommended!

Although a staple in Buckhead, the food is good but not great for the price.  As stated in other reviews, there are so many more choices that offer more bang for the buck.  The ambiance is nice and the parking can be minimal at peak times.

name: Home grown GA Restaurant
address: 968 Memorial Dr SE, Atlanta, GA 30316, USA
reviews: Appreciated that a friend of mine invited me for breakfast at Home Grown. This is a great local breakfast spot that is much bigger than it looks. It looks like it has been there for a long time so don't expect fancy seating. The parking is a little tricky but you will figure it out. They offer all breakfast options. The single pancake is huge and good. I loved the crispy edges. I will definitely return.

Wonderful little brunch cafe that I frequent with my friends on the weekends. The menu has nice balance of traditional southeastern breakfast food while also offering a creative new look at some of the classics. Over the few times I've been there, the food is consistent and quick. The service staff is always very friendly and helpful. They make everyone feel like a regular. If you're lucky, you'll be able to catch Shady one morning playing some great jazz piano.

Extremely delicious, I'll definitely be back...
I tried the fried chicken sandwich, it was magnificent, it also came with some type of dipping sauce that reminded me of a cucumber sauce, I'm not sure, but great. Staff was friendly and helpful, although busy they were very attentive and the wait wasn't to long as well. There is something for basically any budget from what I saw at a quick glance. Chill diverse environment, check them out.

Home Grown is Atlanta's best spot for a full, traditional Southern diner breakfast. They have delicious fried foods, blue plates, and baked goods. There is usually a line to get in, especially on weekends. I recommend coming in on a weekday afternoon if you want fast service. Overall, this is an amazing restaurant!

Disappointed. I went for the country fried steak but after a couple of bites I couldn't finish it. It was too chewy. I understand it is not a prime cut but it was way too tough. The mashed potatoes seemed to have been under a heat lamp for a while and not freshly scooped. The overall cleanliness was not impressive. BUT, the staff were amazing and very nice. The place is quaint and like a "greasy spoon" should look. Lots of character. I didn't finish my meal. It has a strong following so maybe my personal experience was an exception.

name: Bones Restaurant
address: 3130 Piedmont Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: Always a great meal and a go to steak house when in the area! Staff always does a great ob and the service is top notch. Steaks are cooked to proper temperature and very high grade of meat.  Sides are like any nice steakhouse they are sharable and very good. We have eaten here on several occasions and always had a fantastic meal and excellent service. I would say this is a must do if in the area. If you want to eat at a great steakhouse book this place you will not be disappointed.

Fantastic high end steak and seafood restaurant.  Service is second to none.  The food and menu are absolutely fabulous.  You will not be disappointed.  In fact, you will agree with everyone else at your table that this is one of the best steak restaurants you have ever been to. Priced very high but appropriate for the personalized service and fantastic food items and great city atmosphere that you will receive.  Easy in and out parking with courteous valet service.

For years this has been my favorite steakhouse in Atlanta until today. My husband and I made a reservation, well in advance, to take my parents here as well as our 9 month old. My parents made arrangements to come  visit us and wanted to see their grandchild. It was noted on our reservation that it was for 4 adults plus a baby. I received a confirmation when I made the reservation as well as a second confirmation yesterday. 4 hours prior to our reservation, I receive a call stating they have a policy  no one under the age of 6 years may dine. It didn't even cross my mind a child wouldn't be allowed. We've never had an issue at ANY fine dining restaurant in Atlanta as well as can't tell you the number of times I've been to Bones. I can't get a babysitter with a few hours notice and would have made other arrangements had I been notified earlier. I asked why I wasn't called prior and they only offered an apology, stated they can't review reservations in advance and then cancelled my reservation. I can assure you they can and have in the past made arrangements ahead of time. I have had a couple private dining events here as well, both personal and business. A mere apology and canceling a reservation hours before is not acceptable.

This place was great. Truly. We popped in for lunch without a reservation (which are highly recommended), but the staff was very nonjudgmental and treated us very well. We were tired from an exhausting morning and casually mentioned that it was our anniversary. Wow. They really went out of their way to make our experience special, regardless of the lack of warning. The food was super simple. The jumbo lump salad was just jumbo lump in a cabbage leaf with some horseradish sauce on the side, for example. But it was HUGE and FRESH jumbo lump - and absolutely delicious. The steak was charred on the outside and tender and red on the inside and served with oven roasted asparagus and was super simple but done PERFECTLY. Highly recommend. Thank you guys for an awesome experience!!!

Amazing views and amazing food. We used a coupon found on Travel Zoo and had no issues. I mentioned on the reservation that it was my friend's birthday and they took amazing care of us. Everyone came over to say happy birthday and our waiter sang (and I mean really SANG) happy birthday to my friend. The ambiance was nice. Cute place for a date, girls night out or happy hour.

name: Staplehouse
address: 541 Edgewood Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews: One of the top 5 meals we ever had across the US and Europe. Appreciated the artistry for it was without doubt art that you ate. The food is the show and perfectly done. What a culinary journey. We love to cook, but there was not one thing that I could even contemplate duplicating. It was one small dish after another leaving us pleasantly satisfied. The marrying of favors and even textures was off the charts. The staff was wonderful, friendly, and helpful. Make note that the hostess station is down a driveway, through the rear of the building, and then down a set of steps. We were so blown away that we are already planning on when to return. If you think volume equates to value then find a buffet to eat at rather than here.

Worth the experience!  The attention to detail, from plating to presentation shows Staplehouse is more than a "restaurant."  We've had many memorable meals here and always leave feeling satisfied knowing it was also going to a good cause.  Try getting there a bit early and visiting the speakeasy upstairs.

I had never experienced a true tasting course menu before. I can totally appreciate now why Staplehouse has a wait list as long as it is! The presentation and of each dish paired with a wine by an experienced sommelier truly made the dining experience one that will remain with me for a long while. Everything was a blend of art, flavor, and talent on the part of the entire staff at Staplehouse.

What an amazing experience! While the food was as opulent as is gets, the atmosphere was so comfortable and laid back. The service was a perfect blend of all the things you would come to expect from a restaurant at this price point.  Kara visited the table which was delightful.  She is truly a joy to chat with and you can tell she is very passionate about everything that is Staplehouse.  I highly recommend the tasting menu accompanied with the beverage pairing.  Let them guide the night and you will have your mind blown.

Best meal we've had. Ever. Delicious, playful, creative. Service was excellent. Staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. Incredible experience and supports a wonderful cause (The Giving Kitchen). Many thanks to Allison and the rest of the Staplehouse staff for a beautiful (and extremely memorable) anniversary dinner. 

P. S. Don't worry about trying to memorize your menu for the evening - they give you a list of all the awesome things you just ate at the very end of the meal.

name: Nan Thai Fine Dining
address: 1350 Spring St NW #1, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: Nan Thai is the only one Thai restaurant here  in Atlanta and I absolutely love coming here. Their menu is outstanding. They have large portions and all very delicious. Staff are fantastic, they served excellently, they made sure all your requests are provided especially that I have allergies to some nuts. They are very nice to consider that small request.  Definitely one of the best in Atlanta. Highly recommended!

It has been a long time since we dined at Nan but the quality has not changed, the service and food continue to be impeccable and top notch. My favorite dish is the whole snapper with chilli sauce, it is just the best snapper anywhere in Atlanta. The cocktail list is also outstanding. One of the best fine dining restaurants in Atlanta.

Nan Fine Dining is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city of Atlanta. From the moment you walk into the door, you know you are in a special place. The ambiance, staff, and service is excellent. The kitchen is open and the fantastic smells waffles throughout. The ingredients are fresh perfectly blended and the flavors are intoxicating. I highly recommend the tasting tree for starters. Nan Fine Dining is the total experience.

If you like Thai cuisine this is the place to be. If you like Thai kicked up to another level make it your aim to be here. But this is fine dining so be prepared to pay for REALLY good food The bill will reflect it.. The service was great , the drinks and ambience just as good. It was quiet where you could have conversation without raising your voice, just a overall great experience.

Excellent food and service. Some of the best fine dining Thai around. Perfect for any special event, I loved the atmosphere,  too. Unfortunately,  the prices are very high which prevents us from visiting often.

name: La Grotta Ristorante
address: 2637 Peachtree Rd, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews:
This is my second time here and I’ve loved the service and food both times. Really great wine selection too! If you’re willing to spend a good amount per person, this is a nice place to celebrate a special occasion. I went for a birthday and they even served complementary champagne at the end!

We had the melon and prosciutto for an appetizer (a nice size for two people) and the calamari. For the entree, I had the quail which was really juicy and tender.

If you love real Italian food made with real fresh pasta and real ingredients then this is the place for you. It is a small restaurant with a very intimate setting and the best Italian food you will ever eat in your life. All of the waiters are very attentive to your needs.  Dress code is business casual and reservations are a must!

Look we have been customers for over 10 years now and have always had great experiences with both the food and the service. I called to make a Mother’s Day order for pickup, my Mother’s Day gift because that’s how much I’ve loved this place. Everything was fine until I asked for a total and then sarcastically I was told a total would not be available until Sunday because that’s when it would be “rung up.” But still I politely said that’s okay and gave my debit card info anyways. Right after the lady asked if a gratuity for servers and staff would be okay and I said of course. She then asked if 20% was okay and I said that’s fine. She had already asked to put me on hold before taking my card info so I just felt kind of rushed. After a couple of minutes of thinking about it I thought how can I commit to a 20% tip when I wasn’t even given a total? I’m a mother of 2 young kids and this kind of dinner is a splurge plus the drive to the city because we are not local to the area. I called back and the same employee answered, I’m not going to name her directly, and I explained that of course we would leave a tip but could we decide that at the time of pickup? She said yes and she understood and then I got hung up on...no thank you or see you on Sunday, goodbye, just click. Keep in mind this was well over a $100 order. Just so unprofessional and flat out rude! And so unnecessary right now given the circumstances! Yes, everyone is under more stress and anxiety right now but that is no way to run a business! And I know all of those employees need support and extra help right now in restaurants and businesses everywhere. We could have chosen to support our local mom and pop restaurant businesses in our town but this is what I wanted for my Mother’s Day. Lesson learned, if you are not a weekly regular of this restaurant, then do not expect anything extraordinary. And for the price you should be treated like queens and kings every single time. So, so disappointed but will be canceling the order first thing in the morning and not sure when we’ll be back for dine in. Now more than ever is the time to be spreading positivity and kindness, not being unnecessarily disrespectful and rude.

This is a hidden gem in Atlanta. Located in the basement of an extremely unassuming condominium tower, La Grotta is a very authentic and tasty Italian restaurant. Everything in the menu seems to be well prepared and extremely tasty and the service is excellent as well. It's a bit on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for every time. I recommend going here for something romantic or just a fancy outing. You will enjoy it and want to come back soon.

This is my second time here and I’ve loved the service and food both times. Really great wine selection too! If you’re willing to spend a good amount per person, this is a nice place to celebrate a special occasion. I went for a birthday and they even served complementary champagne at the end!

We had the melon and prosciutto for an appetizer (a nice size for two people) and the calamari. For the entree, I had the quail which was really juicy and tender.

name: Atlanta Breakfast Club
address: 249 Ivan Allen Jr Blvd NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
reviews: A wonderful spot to sit down and enjoy a great breakfast. Something for everyone here.  You will not be disappointed with whatever you or your family orders. I ordered the Chicken Biscuits. You get two nice size pieces of chicken and two flaky biscuits. The waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable.  Conveniently located right next to the Georgia Aquarium and just minutes from the Mercedes Benz Dome and State Farm Arena. I must do if you are close to downtown.

I was hungry for chicken and waffles. Google told me this is one of the best spots. Showed up at 915 am on Sunday and we were told the wait was 30 minutes. Promptly by 945 am we were seated (our party had 2 people only).

From that point on, service was lightning fast and very helpful. We ordered the peach cobbler French toast and the chicken and waffles. Everything was scrumptious! In particular, the breading on the chicken was surprisingly light, so you didn't feel as full as you do when eating other dishes of this type. 

All in, our bill was under $40. Great food and well worth the wait!

My daughter and I took my grandson out to breakfast on February 26, 2020, and had a horrible experience from the moment we arrived. As we were approaching there was another family reading a sign on the door, which said use other door. They started to walk to the right looking for another door. As we walked up an employee, a middle aged woman wearing royal blue pants and a ponytail came to the door and pushed it open and said "were open".  Even though her demeanor was less than professional we continued inside. Once inside the hostess the same woman who came to the door,  still not smiling or even having a pleasant look on her face says "I'll be right with you". In that moment I thought to myself, well there fast if nothing else. She came back and said follow me, as we began to follow her, she looked back and said no not you, they were here first. Referencing the family that tried to go in another way. Even though we walked in first I didn't have a problem with it because they were. She just could have done it better by not looking directly at me, when she said to follow her. Strike two at this point but still thinking that it has to get better. When she returned, she said follow me and we did. She then walked us to the other side of the restaurant and said wait 1 minute, I asked where are you seating us? She pointed to a table in the middle, I then said great because I don't want to be along the wall. She said no I'm going to put you there, pointing to the same table in the middle. She then went and put another couple at the same table she had just said 45 seconds prior is where we would be seated. Strike three for sure, or is it. She then returned and tried to seat us along the wall, which is where I told her I didn't want to sit. She says is there a problem and I could barely speak  for shock. I then told her,  you said you were putting us at that table and then you placed someone who came after us there after telling me it was our table. Knowing that she had messed up, she turned to me and said I'll follow you,  where would you like to sit?  I looked around and the only seats were where I asked not to be seated. We left with a hungry 3 year old in tow.  I will never return, I was made to feel less than and that will never be acceptable. It's important to hire respectable,  caring employees.  Treat all customers equally, it shouldn't matter if your visiting Atlanta or live a block away.

Atlanta Breakfast Club was an amazing delight! The food and hospitality from the crew here was GREAT! Had the Loaded Chicken Biscuit and Gravy and let me tell you about the perfection they have came up with. Extremely savory and just the right amount of food! I suggest any travel or local to check out the ABC!!! I'll be back some time to try the Breakfast Tacos!!!

We were in town for the weekend and have been wanting to try this place and there is always a line it seems. We waited about 50 minutes to be seated. They had heaters outside to sit by for chilly mornings. Once we were seated the service was very very fast! The food was great and so was the coffee. FYI you can reserve a table on YELP for this restaurant. Wish I would have known that sooner.

name: Bacchanalia
address: 1460 Ellsworth Industrial Blvd NW Suite 1, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: Loved this place. Being from the area, we had heard about it for a long time, but never been. We finally went there for an anniversary dinner, and it lived up to its reputation. All the food we tried was delicious. The service was beyond what we have experienced at most other nice restaurants. I have been here 4 times and have never been dissatisfied. The dishes are all perfectly prepared and delicious. The prix fixe menu takes all the stress out of the meal. As long as you are prepared to spend $200 per person (I’m adding $ for wine and tip) you will not be disappointed!

We have never had a bad meal at Bacchanalia. Everything here is wonderful. The staff is attentive and helpful. The food is exquisite. We come here to celebrate our birthdays every year and they always make it a special occasion. Cannot wait to go back again for our next meal here. Wow such a great experience and meal. Thank you so much!!!

So to let you know I have never had a better dining experience when it comes to customer service. The wait staff was prompt and engaging, quick with information about dishes and drinks. At one point totaling providing a cocktail on the fly for me to enjoy. Warmest thanks also to the spirits guru on site loved hearing about your passion and hope that it continues to flourish. As for why not the fifth star... for me it was the disconnect from some of the dishes. For a long time I love being told a culinary story visually, textually, and via flavors. This was lacking in our meal. There were hits though (mushroom broth, and crab fritter) but with some parts lacking seasoning and others having flavor disconnects. However this will not keep me from giving Bacchanalia another go. Upon that second visit I hope to change this to five!

Simply amazing!  The food was appealing both to the palate and the eyes.  Everything was prepared with great skill and care.  The wait staff is pleasant and always there when needed, but very inconspicuous so you can enjoy the moment with your company.  Great special occasion place. Worth the cost for such an incredible experience.

The best food in Atlanta. I was blown away by the quality of the food and mixture of flavors. They truly have a gifted chef. The setting was elegant the service was excellent. It is very pricey so it is best reserved for special occasions.  They even gave us a free to go desert on our way out the door.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse
address: 3101 Piedmont Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: We have been going here for several years, and it feels like the service has been getting slower each time. The meat options are still good, but it takes awhile for them to be brought around. The cauliflower steak is a great option for vegetarians or people who aren’t feeling steak. There is also the salad bar that has lots of options, like chicken salad and various cheeses. The sides they bring to the table, like Brazilian cheese bread and fried bananas, are delicious! The servers are very courteous, but they may just need more people to bring around the meats.

This place is awesome! My husband and I went here on Valentine’s Day and and there a long wait as expected. Our waiter Andrew was amazing! Perfect conversation. He knew exactly what we needed and when we needed it. He honest and highly educated about all the menus options. I even overheard him offering to write down recipes for the couple that inquired about the recipe of a menu item. He was just awesome!!! Can’t wait to come back!!!

The concept of this restaurant is an open buffet - unlimited meat and salad. Eat until you drop for 40/pax. Selection of meats is alright - cooked to perfection, plus an added Brazilian traditional appetizers, mostly bananas. I love the free dessert for birthday celebrants - so sweet of them to give that to their guests. Service is excellent, as well as the ambience. This location is smaller compared to similar restaurants we’ve tried in the past. Drinks are everywhere - they have bars if you want to try their wines and mixed drinks. Price is okay for one time occasion with family and friends.

The lamb was amazing, best I’ve had since moving to Atlanta. Also the experience was amazing. Sergio was a waiter for the evening and he did a spectacular job. He was able to get quick grip on what my +1 and I wanted. He had great suggestions, even with the mixed drinks! Super patient, super kind, FABULOUS.

It has been a tradition for say like the last four or five years our office does our Christmas lunch here. Probably the most amazing salad bar anywhere. But was extremely happy to see you can now order just one meat to have instead of all different types and for me way too much. Doing the individual offers of meats is perfect, and exactly what I did. Service has been great every time. Highly recommend!

name: Wisteria
address: 471 North Highland Avenue Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: We were directed to Wisteria by our hotel concierge. This is the place that you want to go to run into local movers and shakers. A relatively small and quaint restaurant. A special shout out to the host, Thomas. Very courteous and thoughtful He offered us a cocktail on the house as a courtesy because of our tight seating arrangement. He took charge and made us feel welcome. We had a great experience because of his courtesy and professionalism. A true southern gentleman. Highly recommend to my fellow travelers.

This restaurant was a pleasant surprise I read reviews on wisteria and said that one day I'd come. I'm so glad I finally did. It's a nice eclectic little hole in the wall type of place. You wouldn't expect to see such nice works of art just from walking by outside. Once inside, the staff was very helpful and attentive. They made great good recommendations.  The food was as unique as it was delicious.  Me and my husband will definitely come back. If you find this review helpful, please press like below.

We were directed to Wisteria by our hotel concierge. This is the place that you want to go to run into local movers and shakers. A relatively small and quaint restaurant. A special shout out to the host, Thomas. Very courteous and thoughtful He offered us a cocktail on the house as a courtesy because of our tight seating arrangement. He took charge and made us feel welcome. We had a great experience because of his courtesy and professionalism. A true southern gentleman. Highly recommend to my fellow travelers.

Great atmosphere and good food! Steak was great, a little more done than medium, but okay. The fried pie was just not that great, really expected a larger portion for the price and it was very tart. All in all it was a good place to eat.

Great food! Great service! I had the trout and ordinarily I wouldn’t order trout but it came highly recommended and it was 10/10. Crab bisque was amazing. Arancini was 10/10. Everything was good! Cool atmosphere. Not the place you want to go if you’re looking for a more private, quiet dinner because the tables are pretty close together and you can basically hear everyone’s conversations. Very European style dining. But a GREAT spot for a casual date night.

name: Gunshow
address: 924 Garrett St, Atlanta, GA 30316, USA
reviews: OK that might be over the top, but it was one of the most unique and fun dinner experiences I've had. First the concept, the chefs offer their dishes, with moments for you to decide thumbs up or down...and they offer every single thing on the menu (unless there is allergy). The action moves fast. Good news is whatever you pick, it is fantastic. Octopus was top notch. There was a bean dish that was unbelievable. Unique carrot cake. Food is extremely inventive. Let the excellent staff guide you.

My son brought us to this restaurant when I was visiting him in Atlanta. Very cool concept and hip atmosphere! Tapas sized plates allow you to try a lot of different items - many I may not have ordered off the menu! There were 4 of us in the party and we worked out way through substantially all the menu - sampling some excellent cuisine. Highly recommend giving it a try.

Absolute must do if you visit Atlanta or live here. Our server, Ruth, really complimented to the feel and atmosphere of the restaurant, even though the food alone speaks for itself and isn't in need of any advocacy. It was, as promised, a unique and unforgettable experience. So glad we found this special spot. 
(Also completely changed our die hard discrimination against quail)

Gunshow never ever disappoints! 

All the chefs are amazing. The presentation of the food is fun. Love that you get to see everything before you say yes/no. Though if you have a hard time telling people no, you may be walking out paying more than you meant to! 😬

You’ll probably be surprised and say yes to something that sounded weird, or say no to something you thought you’d hate. Try it all! Every single dish on the ever-changing menu will be worth it. 

The drinks are also tasty. Drink list is decent.

It like dimsum style. The chefs come out with their dishes and tell you about it and if you like it you get it. It's meant to be shared but portions are small but it's high quality ingredients so it's an experience. I think the menu changes often. It's a lot of fusion food which makes it fun and playful. Dishes can be anywhere from 14-26 and you can order more than one. It's a bit pricey but I really enjoyed the whole vibe of the people here. Parking is in the back and it's free. Drinks were good and they use metal straws ! 🐢 ❤️

name: Babette's Cafe
address: 573 North Highland Avenue Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: One of my favorite spots for fine dining in the city. This was my third visit and it was just as delicious and enjoyable as my previous two visits. Reserved a spot on the outside patio (which is covered and has heaters, so it was not cold at all) and we were the only ones seated there for the duration of the night. Talk about fantastic ambiance. All the food was delicious, our server was very friendly and fun, and even the valet was courteous and amiable. I love Babette's Cafe, the biggest shame is that I don't get a chance to come here more often.

A fantastic restaurant. We enjoyed the drinks and food very much. The grilled octopus and mussels were delicious. The sauce of mussels was the best one we have ever had so far. The desserts (brulee and chocolate bread pudding) were also tasty. It is noteworthy that the entrees were also good, although not as impressive, possibly because the appetizers had raised our expectation too much. Overall, the quality is worth its price. I will definitely come back with family and friends.

The food and service was excellent.  The trout and filet were the choices for our table.  Both are good choices. The chocolate cake was a great dessert choice. Our server, Ginger, was very personable. Very attentive but not intrusive.

An amazing place with requisite dishes all around!

Each dish really feels home made, and the whole place reminds me of my times in France both in ambience and in quality!

A definite must while you're in Atlanta!

I go to this unique place often  as I like the special air that is characterizes this place. The crew is extraordianrillyremarkably helpful and well trained. The service is absolutely quick. Most important, the food they cook is outstanding. I visited often and I was always satisfied. The expense is decent. I suggest this restaurant to to all.

name: Cooks & Soldiers
address: 691 14th St NW, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: INCREDIBLE! First time to this location. When you walk in, you have this very warm and elegant environment. This place has been put on the favorite list officially! Was here to celebrate a birthday and it was outstanding! The food was different, unique to taste, and presented beautifully! The service was exceptional! The dinning experience was very refreshing to this type of food! Was just an outstanding experience. Between the experience, the service, and the food; it was definitely worth every penny. Will be coming back soon!

Would highly recommend. The duck thigh was a must, such good flavor. I never would have tried the escargot fried rice had it not been for the amazing service that suggested it. So delicious. Also - get the grilled cheese (bikini) when you go. The best. I've. Ever. Had.

Really really enjoyed this place. The staff was knowledgeable and on point.   The cocktails were inventive and the wine paired expertly.  And the food. Oh the food. We barely got into the menu and left fully sated. Awesome.

Incredible experience. We came with 12 including one vegetarian and none of us went home dissatisfied. The appetizers were amazing and a couple of guys eat octopus for the first time and were blown away. The vegetarian dishes were incredible and the choices were abound for everyone. One of our friends comes to this restaurant with a vegan friend every time she is in Atlanta so very Vegan friendly as well. And service was casual but very good with great suggestions.

What a fun night. Went there with friends to celebrate a 50th birthday. The experience was so fun. Carter, our server, was very knowledgeable about both the food and the drink menus and worked really hard to make our experience unique and memorable for us. The food was exceptional and unlike anything we've had before. 

Definitely looking forward to when we can return and try the many other interesting menu items.

name: Miller Union
address: 999 Brady Ave NW, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic experience that we would struggle to find fault with. The menu was varied without being overwhelming, and everything sounded delicious. Indeed, the food we orders was amazing- fresh, beautifully presented and perfectly cooked, coupled with service that  was quick, polite and informative. The recommendation on the desserts was particularly excellent. The cocktail menu was similarly enjoyable and though neither myself nor my partner are big drinkers, we were both able to find something we both liked. We will be returning very soon!

Absolutely to die for! My partner and I are both chefs, and we agreed that this is likely the best meal we've ever had. 
Our server, Charlie, was fantastic. Attentive, able to answer all of our questions, friendly, and not a helicopter server at all.
The food was so fantastic. We got two appetizers, entrees, dessert, and cocktails. All of which were equally amazing and reasonably priced. 
The details in everything were great. Beautiful place .
We will definitely be back. Ten stars.

Very nice ambiance, great service and a very nice Old World wine list. Also, great cocktails, especially the Miller Thyme! The appetizers were great and we enjoyed the fritters and the egg. The entree selection was outstanding- and we thoroughly enjoyed the Brisket and the Ravioli dish. This place is truly a hidden gem!

We arrived with a family gathering of 11 people. Even though we kept switching places at the table in order for different family members to catch up with each other, the waiter was able to recall who ordered which dish. The food was healthy and delicious. We ordered a wide variety of appetizers. My favorite was the kale salad with lemony dressing and the various dishes with exotic radishes. My New York strip steak was cooked to perfection. The four teenagers at the table were able to order fancy non-alcoholic drinks that they liked so much they ordered again and again

As out of towners, tried this place based on reviews. Upscale (reservations recommended). Well conceived and laid out dining room, knowledgeable, patient, well trained wait staff. No background music, a ;plus. Apps: house made humus, average. Hush puppies, done right. Lamb meatballs, tender, well  flavored.. Entrees: Tile fish, broiled in butter, good crust, pistachio/grapefruit accompaniment, nice combo. Brisket a disappointment, not special and strangely salty. All in all, well set up, food beautifully presented, looks better than it eats.

name: Poor Calvin's
address: 510 Piedmont Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Good food, they give you PLENTY! Always a great experience and one of my favorite bartenders now works there! I gave it four stars because it's kind of a tight squeeze  and if you don't have a reservation it could be a wait. But the hosts are always mindful of this and sometimes will work you in quicker than they promised. You also have to valet park as street parking is difficult but I guess all of this adds to the character of the place.

We were impressed by everything at Poor Clavins! The interesting cocktail menu made it difficult to choice but “Frankly My Dear” is the most unique and glamorous of all—rose petals floating on a perfect combination of flavors! We loved our entrees. The sea bass was the best. Colleagues enjoyed tofu and seafood dishes. We had the unusual unfortunate experience of having a “kitchen error” that was a problem with a colleague’s entree.
