The staff went out of their way to help her and handled it so PROFESSIONALLY! We were impressed!

Went to Poor Calvin's last night with wife and friends. First off our waitress she was very attentive.and very acknowledge about the menu there. Secondly the Food is truly Delicious. I tried 3 appetizers and each one was incredibly. Then my main dish the Ribs were deep fried and out of this world Delicious. We all had a excellent time there. Will highly recommend this Restaurant to everyone. My place you will fall in love with.  See you soon

The food was really good. They accommodated removing certain ingredients. The location is in a decent area. Not too fond of parking although they offer valet. We made an reservation so the wait was minimal. Our server was personable. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and offered suggestions. I have enjoyed the food each time I come here and will be back.

We went for brunch and it was fantastic. I got the shrimp and grits with Cajun sausage. The grits weren’t overpowered by the other flavors and it was cheesy and creamy. My friend got a fried fish curry dish - the curry sauce was the best thing I tasted all week. We got the fried goat cheese appetizer and that also did not disappoint. Would definitely go back.

name: Fox Bros. Bar-B-Q
address: 1238 DeKalb Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: The pulled pork and brisket was some of the most tender meat I have ever eaten. The seasoning was perfectly balanced. I also had the smoked wings, which were excellent. The barbecue sauce was tangy, hot, and a bit sweet. It tasted like no barbecue sauce I have ever had before. All around the meal was excellent. Great food. Highly recommended.

As a write this my mouth is watering for more of their BBQ sauce. I got the sliced brisket sandwich. Awesome Awesome Awesome. Top it off with some fox-a-roni and sweet tea. Man this place was GREAT. Seriously I am sad it is not closer. Definitely a must if you're anywhere near Atlanta. Really the best BBQ I've ever had.

We are from KCMO so BBQ is a huge thing for us, we were in Atlanta for business and was craving some BBQ.  Like most people, we used Google to find the best BBQ in the area and found this cute little place.  Definitely did not disappoint! Everything we had was so delicious, fall off the bone ribs that were moist and full of flavor. The Mac and Cheese was delicious. The brisket was good! We will definitely come back if/when we are in the area again!

Outstanding Texas BBQ. Great service. Got my order in 6 minutes Had the pulled pork plate with Mac and cheese and baked beans. Very authentic! It's crazy popular on week days with contractors, which is a good sign but can be difficult to get a table. This place is the real deal and worth the wait!

Amazing food! Friendly service. So busy! Get there early, parking goes quick. Try their name sake cocktail. Fresh citrus and a honeysuckle vodka. The brisket comes either chopped or sliced. Very tender and you have the option for fatty or lean with the sliced brisket. The pulled pork is tender and juicy. Great flavor without sauce. The tots covered with Brunswick stew are amazing! A meal in itself. The jalapeno and cheese sausage is great with the pimento cheese. Definitely worth a drive to try this place. Was very dark inside, but we ended up sitting outside to get a quick table. Chairs outside were comfortable.

name: Nikolais Roof
address: Hilton Atlanta, 255 Courtland St NE, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews:
What a great dining experience we had at Nikolais Roof.
The food was prepared perfectly and delivered to the table right on time throughout the four courses that we had selected. 
Everyone from the Valet, Host and Wait staff was very friendly, professional and enjoyable to talk to. It made us feel welcome and it all made our anniversary a memorable one.
The waiter and restaurant picked up our parking and had our car waiting pn us at the door when we left.
I highly recommend Nikolais Roof for dining or special occasions.  You will not be disappointed so give it a try. You will be back

We were in town for a convention and was told about Nikolai’s Roof restaurant. So glad we were told about this place...The food was amazing! My dinner was great. Thoroughly enjoyed it. And the service was outstanding. Scott was our server and he did an excellent job. Needless to say we were glad we came here for dinner. It was a good choice.

Started with the crab cake, the flavor was delicious, juicy, but a tad more seared than I prefer.  The greens beneath were such a great pairing, and the preparation was unique.  Another starter, the braised boar risotto was also very tasty, and a break from the norm.  My wife had the beef tenderloin, and it was delicious, and cooked to the appropriate temperature, flavor, bite and chew were all what you would expect from a restaurant of this caliber.  I had the herb crusted lamb chops.  In fairness, they were cooked well, the seasoning was great, but were pungent than any other lamb chops I've ever had - sorry for the poor quality on the photo, low light and dimmed screen weren't exposed until I posted this review.  The symphony bar, with the cinnamon ice cream was delicious, divine even.  The creme brulee was not our favorite.  All in all a 5 star experience, and the view wasn't hateful until the fog rolled in.  Staff was super friendly and patient in helping my wife find a wine that she enjoyed.

This was a very pleasant 1st time dining experience. The view from our table was magnificent and the atmosphere was quiet while not stuffy. Our waitress knew every detail of the 3-5 course menu. Cocktails and wine were excellent. Will dine again.
Fine dining with a great view. On a clear day you can see Stone Mountain. The restaurant will validate parking, even if you valet. Don't forget to tip your valet!

name: South City Kitchen
address: 1144 Crescent Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews:
They seated us promptly during the lunch rush. Location is great but parking is just street parking. We ordered the pimiento cheese appetizer and shrimp &grits which was average. The fried chicken meal was delicious though! Also, you get a biscuit and corn bread basket and they were made fresh and oh so perfectly. 
Would definitely come again👍

The food is fantastic! The service is top-notch. Our server was knowledgeable of the menu and gave us some amazing recommendations. We had the beer salad with goat cheese which is a must! My sister had the crab bisque, which was rich and creamy. Our entrees consisted of fried chicken and pork chop dishes. Both proteins were cooked sublimely. My only critique would be the wine sauce that accompanied the pork. I do not think it was reduced enough. It was somewhat bitter and the taste of alcohol was still heavily present.

Nonetheless, my experience was wonderful. I will definitely be back next time! 

P.S. The complementary cornbread and biscuits was fantastic.

It has been a few years since my last time dining at South City Kitchen, but this is a place that has not let itself slip in standards. The food is still outstanding and the service is attentive. Our table of 7 tried a variety of dishes and everyone loved their choices. The cauliflower appetizer was a standout for me. Our server was knowledgeable about all of the food options as well as the wine pairings. Water glasses were refilled without having to be asked. Definitely worth it!

I enjoyed this restaurant. Made a reservation here and the staff was friendly and helpful. The food was well seasoned and their signature fried chicken was tasty. Also tried the pork chop and a couple of appetizers which were all prepared well and delicious. Great spot for a nice dinner in midtown Atlanta. Enjoy!

Food and place is a National treasure. Our server Trinity was fantastic and actually let me try the fried green tomatoes which I had never had before. It was divine. Fried chicken and mashed potatoes plus the pan seared scallops left me speechless. Dinner for 2 check left me wondering if the computers math was accurate. So affordable given their location and quality food. I personally thanked the Chef. Going back soon I’ll have to try the entire menu eventually. Thanks Trinity!!!

name: Halal American Deli
address: 66 Walton St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: I never know that this American Deli was here, but I’m glad I found it! The guys in there are very nice and they seem to really care about their craft. The food was hot, fresh, and CRISPY! I tried the fish, and the amount they gave me for seven dollars was incredible. The fish was great too.

This place is pretty good. I got a 20 piece hot with fries. Everything is cooked to order. Manager is very helpful, nice, and polite! Their open on Sundays which is big plus if you're in the area and want some wings.

I’m giving 5 stars on the night team alone... Saturday night around 11:50 was amazing. Not only was it easy to order they also explain every ingredient inside of the sauces. Love them can’t wait to come back!!!! Shot out to the manager and the guy from NY!!! From the cashier to the cook... simply AMAZING! Thank you!!

Hands down the best wings I’ve had in Atlanta in a while. Definitely going back to try out the other items on the menu! Also the owner there is very kind and respectful so you’ll always have a good experience there.

This place is a hidden gem!  The owner was very kind and personal. The wings were different from what I was used to and they were fantastic!!! The lemon pepper chicken batter was crispy and seasoned really well. I was very surprised when he offered me crackers from my country. I will definitely be coming back.

name: Chama Gaúcha Brazilian Steakhouse
address: 3365 Piedmont Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: Amazing experience! This was my first time at a Brazilian steakhouse, but I was there with a seasoned diner. I'm not sure if I enjoyed the salad bar or all the meats the most. Everything on the salad bar was so fresh and delicious! Pace yourself and try a little bit of everything. You won't be disappointed. You may be stuffed at the end, but it will be worth it.

We enjoy going out. Last night we  found this excellent restaurant which friends recommended to us. We passed a beautiful time there with first-rate cooking and  an experienced team and a talented  chef. We put this restaurant in our list  and we shall no doubt come back very soon. We deeply recommend.

I arrive at this unique place often since I enjoy the ambiance that is exist in this place. The staff is extraordianrillyremarkably loyal and experienced. The service is pretty fast. Not to mention, the food you get is highly distinguished. I visited more than once and I was always joyful. The price is honest. I recommend this place to to all.

This was a complete delight. The service was wonderful. The salad/sides bar had plenty to choose from. I got hooked on the apple salad and chicken salad. The pork was so tender and flavorful. Shrimp were delicious. The lamb chops and filet were also my faves. Great experience. Ready to go back...now!

On 2/23/20 SUNDAY AT CHAMA GAUCHA BRAZILIAN STEAKHOUSE was the best professional and delightful experience from the cute hostess to the handsome waiters and even the fantastic manager!!!🙌the food and drinks were everything and the restaurant was like a fairytale. My family and friends can't stop talking about i they enjoyed it was a great ANNIVERSARY I WILL BE BACK!THANK YOU FOR YOUR KINDNESS!🥰🥰🥰

name: Mary Mac's Tea Room
address: 224 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: Outstanding restaurant with something for everyone.  This restaurant is truly a throwback to the past. You review the menu and then you actually write down your own order.  Appetizers, Entrees, Sides, Drinks, Adult Beverages and Desserts.  They have the best fried chicken, pot pies and Grilled Pork Chops.  If you are in town and looking for an unique place/experience look no further.  You can not go wrong picking this place.

One of the top Southern restaurants in Atlanta. All food is made from scratch and from the original recipes. Fried chicken was super tender and fried to perfection. There are a variety of sides to choose from which enhance the main dish. If it is your first time ensure you notify your server for some Southern hospitality. The atmosphere is full of history and the original building is still in use. This was a fantastic experience and a must try if you are searching for Southern comfort food.

Very tasty southern food and wonderful atmosphere, was a very comfortable place to hold into during a rain storm. Sat at the bar area and loved talking and getting recommendations from bartender. Started with a yummy Mint Julep.
Food was amazing! I tried the chicken fried chicken & would highly recommend. Had the sweet potato souflee & green beans as sides. The bread basket was very tasty too.

This was our first visit there and we enjoyed it very much. My husband had the meat loaf but probably would not order it again. It was good but not as good as Cracker Barrels. I had the chicken pot pie and it was great! Our friend had the turkey and dressing and other than  bringing her cocktail sauce instead of cranberry sauce her meal was delicious too. They did correct that mistake! My husband had mac and cheese and I wish I had ordered it too! The rolls and corn bread were wonderful and all in all it was a special place to dine.

Fantastic southern cuisine! Nothing I ordered was bad. The portions are huge so I had to bring a good portion of it home. The atmosphere was "southern dining room". Clean. Wait staff was great, and very helpful when ordering. I went there for lunch, but would only go back for dinner (comfort food makes me sleepy).

name: Atlas
address: 88 West Paces Ferry Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews:
Went to the St. Regis to view the Garden Room Restaurant. Arrived to receive the great customer service that the hotel is known for. Loved the ambiance of the Garden Room Restaurant. Walked in to what seemed to be a beautiful atrium connected to a grand home, just with a bar. Decor well thought-out with beautiful plants, artificial and live. Love the way the seating was an ordered hodgepodge. My only complaint with the seating, where we were seated, is that the servers were having issues with getting around in the close quarters. The food is very tasty and loved the sharable portions. The service was great.

My only regret is that I don't remember our server's name. She served us three guys with a feeling that we were having dinner with her and not as customers. I am not a pork or beef eater, so she recommended items that definitely did not have beef or pork bi-products. Enjoyed the adventure into the garden.

Amazing experience for me and my girlfriend. We were celebrating our 2 year anniversary and the staff made it a night to remember. I cannot express enough how wonderful the experience was from ease of booking the reservation, service, attention to detail and atmosphere. Loved every moment. Thank you Atlas! A must go for a unique and special experience.
Service is AMAZING! Joseph is an amazing sever. Had the caviar flight and a fish dish that was AMAZING. Hubbi had aged beef waygu that was out of this world! Marbleized to perfection!

Probably the best restaurant experience I've had in Atlanta. Every single thing we ordered was fantastic from the wine to the sides to the soups to the entrees. The service was incredible and we were made to feel like the only people in the building. One person at the table asked if they could make beef tartare and not only did they agree even with it not on the menu, but it came out as a complete fully imagined dish. It takes a real chef to be able to create a full dish on the spot and really speaks to the quality of dining here
Incredible meal. Truly special food and excellent service. Plan to spend some time between courses. This isn't the place to rush through a meal. That's not how they do it. Linger and enjoy.

name: JCT. Kitchen & Bar
address: 1198 Howell Mill Rd #18, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: Traditional farm-to-table restaurant.  Food was very fresh.  Rolls were to die for. I ordered the pork and my husband ordered the lamb shank. Mine was good but not as tender as I expected and my husband said his was excellent. Sides were really good, fingerling potatoes and carrots. The ambience was okay as the seating reminded me of being in Europe with how close some of the tables are, including ours. Our server was outstanding and everyone else we encountered.

American food with all kinds of twists. Whatever the sauce is with the asparagus is over the top good. I must say, the fried chicken was moist, however, just not enough spice. Almost there, but a tad bit bland. Friend loved the rabbit. Fries were great. Cool bar upstairs. Nice place.

Had lunch at JCT kitchen today and just had to post a review because the shrimp and grits were AMAZING. The best I’ve had in a looooong time. The croutons.... yum. Still thinking about it many hours later. My mother ordered the vegetable plate, which was also incredibly delicious. Veggie plates can be hit or miss and this one was definitely a hit. We had the chocolate hazelnut tart for desert which was also delicious. Service was good, just a bit slow for lunch. Totally worth the wait, looking forward to going back.

Awesome food and attentive service. Went for a party.  20 people.  From salad to dessert the service and attention was expert in class. Food type was common place but prepared in unique and unusually flavorful. 5 star meal served in courses. 
EXTRA points for this size group.  EXCELLENT follow up and communication. Additional servers stepped in smoothly when needed. Friendly staff and a good variety of music playing overhead.

Had lunch at JCT kitchen today and just had to post a review because the shrimp and grits were AMAZING. The best I’ve had in a looooong time. The croutons.... yum. Still thinking about it many hours later. My mother ordered the vegetable plate, which was also incredibly delicious. Veggie plates can be hit or miss and this one was definitely a hit. We had the chocolate hazelnut tart for desert which was also delicious. Service was good, just a bit slow for lunch. Totally worth the wait, looking forward to going back.

name: BoccaLupo
address: 753 Edgewood Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: Really happy to be able to order from here during COVID. While it's hard to get through, but it is certainly worth the effort. Love the professionalism and commitment to the well being of the community during this crisis. The employees always have masks and a pickup routine that minimizes unnecessary contact. Well done! Also we love your food!!! 😋

Went here last week for our anniversary. All the apps, pasta dishes, and desserts we tried were delicious. The wait staff were all friendly and attentive. The wine pairings recommended by our server were good. Next time may try the 4-course tasting menu!

We had a reservation and were sat promptly. While we diner several other tables remained open the whole time while the bar and patio were busy with people waiting. Not sure if the kitchen was backed up or what. The waitstaff seemed to be tripping over each other with not enough to do while guests were being quoted long waits (over an hour) while tables sat empty. 

I do wish there were a few more non-pasta options. We don’t eat a lot of pasta so it will likely be a long time before we return.

Our experience was perfect. Our server explained the menu beautifully and offered excellent advice for both my vegetarian friend and omnivorous self. The texture of the house-made pasta was perfect and the dishes beautifully composed. The wine list is small, but expertly curated. Give the desserts a try - they are not overly large and are complex and delicious.

We’ve been here many times and have never been disappointed. The entree menu is limited but everything is interesting and prepared perfectly. It’s a short walk to Krog Street Market and the Beltline from here. The 20 yolk tagliatelle and the black spaghetti are iconic here. The servers are passionate and knowledgeable about the wine list and the food choices.
Stopped by for a light dinner.  Came early  without reservations so had to sit at the bar.  Not your typical Italian dishes.  Good service.  Flavorful pasta dishes.

name: The Palm - Atlanta
address: 3391 Peachtree Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30326, USA
reviews: Come here with my wife day after Valentine's day, was a great experience. Services was absolute amazing. Food incredible delicious. We enjoyed very much.  I highly recommend.

We had a private room due to a birthday celebration/9 people. The waiter was pleasant. We started out with wine. The waiter suggested the seafood platter for the table as an appetizer. So we did. It came out and it was 2 giant cracked claws and legs and a platter of about 12 shrimp (cocktail). Our hostess was a bit taken aback as we all were because as this was not what we expected. That was basically 1 shrimp per person and we would have to share passing around and digging out crab meat. We expected a full fledge platter. This may work for 2 people but not 9. And it was $150 plus I believe he quoted $18 for the shrimp. The manager was kind enough to take it back for the miscommunication and left the cocktail. The food was very good though. Every thing came out correct no complaints with that. Only thing that could have been better was communication. We are in a room laughing and enjoying ourselves. Instead of bursting into the room, opening the doors, pulling them back locking them, starting to take things as if you were cleaning, (this was basically to tell us to get the hell out) he could have entered the room and advised us at let’s say for example, you close at 9 tell us at a quarter til or just merely state “just to inform you guys our business hours end at or ending at....not to rush you but to inform you we will be closing down soon.” Trust me we would have said thank you and exited. We were finish with our meals and only talking and enjoying one’s company, no one was paying attention to the time. So it was kind of rude on how that played out. Outside of that, we would be back.

I decided to give my husband a surprise party for his birthday and The Palm was the perfect venue for it.  We used one of their private rooms; and although it was the day after Valentine's Day, they accommodated us with no problem.  I did not have to worry about adhering to a minimum balance or extra fee for them slicing my husband's cake.  Establishments should understand that you can get more from the customers when you do not nickel and dime them with little fees here and there.   Amanda, the Sales Manager, was so attentive to every detail for me and provided insight to help me make the best decisions for what I was envisioning.  I did not have to worry about a thing.  The food was amazing and my guests told me multiple waiters were always in the room making sure my guests had everything they needed before my husband and I arrived.  I will definitely be going back to this restaurant again.

Palm Atlanta is a very special restaurant. The manager Andrei always makes you feel like your occasion is the most important to his team at the Palm. The Palm Atlanta is an Italian Steakhouse that offers the best chicken and veal parmigiana in the city. The steak selection will rival any steakhouse in Atlanta. The staff has been trained to treat each guest, each occasion and each event like you are only people in their establishment. Booth 36 is the best seat in the house.

Love The Palm!! Great place to go for dinner with friends/family and great for a dinner meeting as well.  Servers are very friendly, especially Robbie, who took care of us the other night for a birthday dinner.

name: Eats
address: 600 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: This place is super cool. There are 2 lines, the pasta side and the meat and veggie side. Of course you can order at both sides.  I had the jerk chicken, broccoli cheese casserole, Mac n cheese, and spinach pasta. I was all over the place and you pick your seat from booths and tables.

Phenomenal jerk chicken at an unbeatable price point - that's why I gave it five stars. I've been to eats a couple times and only once was the chicken dry, but the flavour is still on point. The jerk fish was very herby and spiced plentifully as well, though do note that the portion is definitely less large than the jerk chicken portions.
Sides are great - note that the cornbread is savoury, not sweet. Beans and rice had subtle flavours that complimented the chicken well.

I’d never been here before, but came in purely based on reviews online. It lived up to all of its reviews. This is one of the best dang places to eat in Atlanta. Try the jerk chicken and Mac and cheese! I personally didn’t like the cornbread, but everything else was tasty.
This has been one of my favorite restaurants since I was in college at Tech. The jerk chicken is simply the best and you can't go wrong with any pasta choice. Trust me, I've tried them all.

Salted cod fries. Who even knew that was a thing? Everything we ordered here was delicious. I especially liked the salmon entree I ordered. It was pretty windy the day we came so sitting on the patio meant that a lot of leaves was blowing into our food, but that didn't ruin the experience.

name: The Optimist
address: 914 Howell Mill Rd, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews: We had two business meals in one week and much to our enjoyment. Both evenings The Optimist was hopping with no empty tables and no intimate tables of two. The place is vibrant, lively, and alive and fun. Our meals both evenings were delicious and everyone at our tables agreed. My best advice is to communicate to your server as to your taste. Try anything on the menu and be adventurous. One item I do remember is another diner and myself shared a larger seafood stew and the kitchen automatically served it on two plates. Nice!

Very nice food! For starters, the octopus was delicious- sweet and spicy. I had the scallops, which were lovely, and a side of blue corn grits. The table also ordered the hush puppies which are delicious- almost like dessert. The ambiance is nice, but it is loud. Would be nice if the music was turned down a bit. Service was fine, nothing special, which I suppose I expected more. Overall, very nice evening!

This is definitely a happening place.  You can sit at the oyster and seafood bar or reserve a table.  Everything on the menu looked too good.  We ordered more food than we can eat.  The oysters were fresh and tasty.  The scallops were of big size.  They were cooked perfectly.  The sides were generous portions.  If I come back to Atlanta, I’d come again.

Fantastic! One word reviews count correct? 

Where to start? From the ambiance, the food, the service, all the way back to making the reservation, The Optimist impresses in every way!  We ordered a number of apps including a variety of oysters and everything was amazing! The seafood chowder (or whatever they called it) was the best I’ve ever had, full of great complimentary flavors and substance! All of our dinners were delicious and were a family who shares so I’m speaking for not only the opinions of my group but personal experience as well.

I was here once before in the mid heat of summer, we sat outside and it was very spur of the moment and things were great! Last nights occasion was planned based on previous experience and were worthy of a full review!

Two words: Top Notch! If you like great seafood in a classy setting, this is the spot for you!

Probably one of the most impeccable eating experiences I have ever had! My husband and I went for Leap Year to celebrate! Our waiter,  Brett was a phenomenal waiter and definitely added to our dining experience! Overall, we are super excited to come back. Definitely a jewel in Atlanta.  🤍

name: True Food Kitchen
address: 3393 Peachtree Rd NE Ste 3058B, Atlanta, GA 30326, USA
reviews: This place is amazing! The food is incredible and you can watch them cook it. The ingredients are high quality. Our waitress was awesome. She explained everything and very patient with us first timers. She found a toy for our two year old to keep her entertained while waiting for food. The squash pie we had for dessert was amazing. Highly recommend this restaurant and the squash pie!

We ordered 2 new dishes & they both were equally delicious!
Now the parking situation was a bit hectic, due to  traffic. I'm not sure if this is the norm or because it was a Saturday evening & the restaurant being attached to a mall. 
Please be mindful of the valet & paid parking areas. The restaurant does not validate paid parking.
Although it took quite some time to park, I'm still giving 5 stars. Here's why - we were 15 mins. late for our reservation, however we were seated as soon as we checked in (and they were busy!), our food arrived shortly after we ordered, all of the staff we encountered were pleasantly kind & accommodating, and the restaurant & restroom were very clean. So yes, 5 stars it is!

I'm currently detoxing and can't eat dairy, sugar, fried foods, caffeine.. you catch my drift and True Food Kitchen is a God send. Fresh and delicious. My server, Erica, was patient and helpful as I interrogated her about dishes. Everything I ordered was amazing. I will definitely return.

Came here during a lunch and it was super busy and they still managed to sit us down very quickly. The food was so fresh and the restaurant was very clean. Our waitress Brianna was also super great, answering all of our questions since it was our first time. Great restaurant, did not disappoint.

Whilst there are a number of True Foods around the US, this one is very good. The menu has some great healthy options and you can get both delicious and nutritious food at True Food. The waiters and waitresses always seem very happy and make the dining experience better. Great whether you’re in a rush or you want to take your time.

name: La Tavola
address: 992 Virginia Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA
reviews: II would highly recommend this spot! We had great food with many authentic Italian options. The ambiance was warm and friendly and bustling. Do get a reservation. The server was fun but knowledgeable. It was tough, really tough to decide what items to order and in what order. I certainly look forward to eating at that establishment again. I can understand why the place is popular.

There are so many great things I can say about this restaurant. There wasn't a bad experience at all. The food was excellent. The service was even better. we love this restaurant and wondered why it has taken us so long to come back. we will definitely make this a more frequent visit.

II would highly recommend this spot! We had great food with many authentic Italian options. The ambiance was warm and friendly and bustling. Do get a reservation. The server was fun but knowledgeable. It was tough, really tough to decide what items to order and in what order. I certainly look forward to eating at that establishment again. I can understand why the place is popular.

The is a tiny place and they have it loaded to capacity so it does feel a bit over crowded! However you will quickly forget feeling cramped once you start eating! The food is excellent! Everything I have tried there is amazing! I definitely recommend the gnocchi!!! The beet salad was extraordinary as well! While from a Manhattanite's point of view I would say the atmosphere is dress down casual the prices are a little more dressed up fancy but not unreasonable! If you are looking for somewhere with a laid back vibe great good and a polite friendly and attentive staff definitely check out La Tavola! You won't be sorry that you did!

This place was great, bread, pasta, cheeses and wine were all top notch. The service was slow, even for a fine dining pace, took 10 min. To be greeted and another 15min for a bottle of wine. 
The server was very knowledgeable and took great care of us after the slow start. The pasta and risotto were my favorite things we had. The New York strip was good, but nothing special. I would go back for the wine and pasta any time!

name: Empire State South
address: 999 Peachtree St NE #140, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: Unique lemonade, a varied wine list, and crafted cocktails started our lunch with a blast! the starter jars were delicious - pimento cheese with bacon jam and fish mouse with mustard seeds were served with tasty bread. The super food entree featuring steak was very good with the steak perfectly cooked. The summer salad was also great with fresh blackberries and buttermilk curds. Lastly was the sea salt caramel ice cream. Our server was Tiffany and she was very helpful with the menu and was quite knowledgeable about wines. Parking is in the garage behind the restaurant and staff validates your ticket so bring it with you.
Simply sublime. Food was great, especially the farm egg dish, very inventive and fun experience. Cocktails were also very week crafted and balanced (and well explained by exceptional staff).

Empire State South was extremely disappointing and I would have given in 3.5 stars if possible. Everything just lacked any real flavor and was entirely too expensive for what we got. All of the dishes looked beautiful though.

We ordered popcorn as a snackie because it’s not everyday you see that on a menu. It must be good, right? The molé it was tossed in provided little flavor and it didn’t taste like there was any salt, which continued to be a trend. Especially with the squash appetizer with the little flavor coming solely from the ricotta cheese.

We wanted to order another appetizer but the disappointment in the first two dishes urged us to just move onto the entrees. Scallops for my wife and the strip steak for me. Again they were both good but lacked anything to make them really stand out for an acclaimed chef such as Hugh Acheson.

At the end of the meal we were left unsatisfied with the flavors and our fill. Especially for the money.

I would not recommend Empire State South if you are looking for any bold flavors.

Love this place! Great vibe, fantastic service, outstanding food! We went for Sunday Brunch and each meal was prepared beautifully. The Breakfast is definitely one of my favorites! It's definitely a great southern experience. A little pricey, but I'd say it's worth it! Also, it's a cute place if you want to take your kids because there's space right outside to play bocce ball or just hang out on the synthetic turf.

Our server, Allie, was delightful and knowledgeable. The menu is tight and provides interesting choices in each category. Try the chips with white bbq, and rotating preparation of the tagliatelle. The restaurant itself feels warm and vibrant with peacock blue walls and windows overlooking the heart of midtown. We had just finished moving in nearby and we plan to return regularly. Thank you to the whole team!

name: SOHO Atlanta Restaurant
address: 4300 Paces Ferry Rd SE #107, Atlanta, GA 30339, USA
reviews: Great Food and amazing drinks! I had the NY Strip and it was cooked to perfection. The wine list and pairings was amazing! Service was awesome. We had drinks and appetizers while we waited for the rest of our party. The BEST calamari in town!!!! Jeff the manager was amazing as he ensured all guests were well taken care of, visiting every table. We will be returning.

My husband and I went to SOHO tonight to celebrate our Anniversary. We just recently moved to the area and this place was perfect! Our server Dan, was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. To top it off Jeff the manager, brought us both a glass of champagne along with our pick for dessert. Thank you for a great experience, we will definitely be back!

Soho is reliable first class experience every single time.

The service is lovely and they have a new tapas and wine pairing menu every Wednesday that is fantastic (you can get either separate as well - and of course, is priced right). They fare here is fantastic you cannot go wrong. Highly recommended.

This place was fabulous!! We went for restaurant week and everything we ordered was divine!! Chicken tortilla soup was the best we have ever had anywhere!! Calamari was excellent!! Short rib was awesome and chicken with mashed potatoes and roasted veggies was very tasty!! We enjoyed dessert!! Service was spectacular!! Wish I had taken pics of entrees before we dug in!!
One of the best in Vinings!! Really great. Make sure to order a super martini - they make the best. The food and service is excellent. I love sitting at the bar even when ordering dinner. A+

name: Marcel
address: 1170 Howell Mill Rd, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA
reviews:
From start to finish this is one of the best date night dining experiences My wife and I have ever had. We got the lobster bisque which comes in a delicious puff pastry, must try it. I had an old fashioned which was perfect. 

The burger was insane. It’s our favorite burger. And it’s worth every penny. I had the new York strip, cooked perfectly, and we split cheesecake for dessert. The ambience is wonderful. The service is top notch.  Can’t wait for our next trip here.

This is a top notch and upscale steakhouse. I have a GREAT experience there. The service was AWESOME. I felt out of place a little bit because most everyone in a formal clothing. The bone marrow and escargot were good the grill butter sourdough  breads come with it was tasty. The tomahawk steaks was tender and flavorful. It's pricey but if you go into a high end restaurant you expect to pay.

I celebrated my nomination last night in this fine place. I am glad to say that we had a pleasant evening and the restaurant was indeed one of the reasons for this fruitful meeting. The waiters  collaborated in a sweet style, the cuisine was extremely good and my guests were extremely  delighted. We shall surely visit again for more celebrations. Thank you very much.

When I asked the people of Atlanta that I came across to recommend a place to eat, Marcel came up a lot. So I made a reservation and ordered the Beef Wellington the day before. Great atmosphere, perfect for a romantic outing. The food was excellent, the beef wellington was perfect. The service prompt and professional. Definitely will go back when in Atlanta.
Literally Heaven on Earth! The food is absolutely amazing, the service is exceptional! A true hidden gem! The bread service is to die for!!! Very romantic atmosphere

name: Chops & Lobster Bar
address: 70 West Paces Ferry Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: This place has AMAZING food! If you go here please dress at least business casual.  The customer service is wonderful. It is very pricey but worth it!

OMG so this was my first time at this place and lets start with the exquisite atmosphere and round the clock service, if anyone was having a bad day you couldn't tell. The food was nothing short of amazing and the setting was so intimate and mood striking and of course we got seating with an excellent view. The prices were a bit high bit definitely worth every penny. If you want to treat yourself and your loved one. I suggest come here for dinner and cocktails 🥃🍸🥐🥖🍞🥩

Nice looking and highly appealing. Well located in a side section of Buckhead and easily accessible by walking from The Shops and nearby areas. They valet but gets busy weekend nights. The food from my experience was good but not outstanding which I would expect from this place. The attention is hit and miss. Ours was mostly good. Our bartender and assistant servers were great but our server seemed to be more dedicated to larger parties than the 3 of us. Overall is a see and be seeing kind of place. I would return for a biz dinner $$$$$
Amazing experience. Our son loved the food. My household is full of foodies so a restaurant that meets all our expectations and deals with a sleepy hangry toddler likes a G

Impeccable service! Amazing. My wife and I celebrated our one year anniversary here. I mentioned this via Open Table and we had no less than 4 staff members stop at our table to congratulate us, all using our names. It was an incredibly thoughtful touch that really made our evening. Of course, the food here is wonderful and the atmosphere warm and inviting. When we are able to go, we are always so pleased at how welcome we feel.

name: 5Church Atlanta
address: 1197 Peachtree St NE #528, Atlanta, GA 30361, USA
reviews: Really enjoyed my experience dining at 5Church. Great date night spot, or place to dress up nice for a light birthday dinner. Everything was great from the cocktails to the appetizers to the dinner menu. Have your coins ready, it’s not moderately priced, but it’s well worth it. Great service, can’t wait to get back!

Everything! 5Church’s Ansley is the best event manager anyone can hope to work with! From the very first response to my inquiry which was prompt and detailed, I knew there was something here as a potential proposal venue. She prepared a program within budget and assisted us with all our questions, plans and changes throughout the weeks leading up to the day of the event. 

Allowing us use the rooftop patio was the cherry on the cake and the views and pictures were all breathtaking. Thoroughly enjoyed doing my proposal here and every single one in our 36-person group enjoyed the food they ate. The place was clean, service was well organized and exquisite and we’d definitely be back for more meals here!

What a great surprise to find this excellent restaurant. First, the knowledgeable waitstaff are obviously well-trained and proud of their working environment. Secondly, the food was extremely fresh and tasty. Probably one of the best meals I've had in a long time! I had an excellent entree of scallops with a side of tasty brussel spouts that were wonderful Will return!

Staff was really great. The hot day cooled off by evening and we ate outside on the second floor deck. Then a thunder storm. A bit off scrambling around, but everybody was cool. The food was excellent. My companion had stuffed lobster tails (hugely, wildly, overpriced and distinctly not local and pointless gastronomically speaking), but I had the shrimp and cheese grits which I took to be Atlanta-style. Best I ever ate.

The atmosphere is chill, dimly lit, great decor for anything for a classy after work drink, semi fancy brunch, or a romantic dinner date. I especially love the well priced, excellently curated snacks during the social hour which I believe is 7 days a week (Absolute steal in Atlanta). The P.E.I. Mussels are my favorite thing on the menu and maybe my favorite mussels in the city. Must try!

name: Kyma
address: 3085 Piedmont Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: Definitely one of the best restaurants in Atlanta. Don’t expect large portions, the prices are great also. Customer service was also superb. My party & I was seated immediately after confirming our reservation.

Phenomenal experience. Jonah Jacobson, chef de cuisine, absolutely killed it. Fried cheese, the best octopus I've had the pleasure of putting in my mouth, and lamb cooked to medium rare perfection. We will be back.

We had a reservation and were seated promptly when we arrived. Our waitress, Ava, explained the menu and made several helpful suggestions. We decided on the tasting menu with a shared entree of trout. All the food was good - and served at the right temperature. Service was prompt but unobtrusive, and we never felt rushed. We’d happily eat here again.

We drive by this spot probably once a day for the last 3 years and finally decided to stop by on a weekday night for a meal. Upon walking in, the vibe and ambiance of the place were really good. The tables aren’t jammed together giving us some privacy. The things you notice, or at least I do. Our server was a guy named Rudy. He was awesome to put it simply. One thing that stood out was how he handled an adult beverage my better half ordered. She wasn’t a fan of it. Unsolicited, he jumped in and brought two other options out and one of those was a winner. We’ve actually never experienced such proactive thinking. I was very impressed. Now for the food! Everything was done as you’d expect. Flavorful & nice presentation, what else can you ask for. We ordered the three appetizers and a whole fish for two which I’d recommend if it’s your first time. No negatives to mention really. We’d go back for sure. I guess it’s fair to say that you would have to be into seafood at this spot. Lots of options from the seas of the world. Hope you enjoy as much as we did.

The food is delicious. No complaints there. I do want to comment on our initial customer service. We were seated and forget about for about 15 minutes. There were a few tables seated after us that were given water and had their order taken before we were even greeted. Finally , we stopped one of the waitresses and told her the situation. She gladly took our drink order and served us but the initial engagement makes it hard to gauge if I would go there again. I did not feel welcomed. Again, the food was great, but I had high expectations for the overall experience and the first impression was definitely below average.

name: Arepa Mía
address: 209 Edgewood Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: These Venezuelan "burgers", or Arepas as they're officially called, are awesome. The cord patties that make the bun are excellent and always served up hot. The meats and veggies you can choose from are always fresh and totally succulent. If you're in ATL, stop on in the Sweet Auburn Curb Market and take in the historic atmosphere of the 100+ year old market and have this special treat.
The arepas are delicious! They make it right in front of you. I also had a side of black bean soup and it was really good. They're usually very busy but they're quick and the service is good.
It's exactly what you want and then some! Truly authentic and full of fresh ingredients. You can custom order or chose from the menu. Either way you win! It's a good deal of food for a fair price.
It's exactly what you want and then some! Truly authentic and full of fresh ingredients. You can custom order or chose from the menu. Either way you win! It's a good deal of food for a fair price.
Arepas tasted great!!!! And totally gluten Free! The Best I have eaten!

name: Red Snapper Seafood Restaurant
address: 2100 Cheshire Bridge Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30324, USA
reviews: I took my grandparents and my younger cousin to The Red Snapper Seafood Restaurant for the first time on New Years Eve and I couldn’t have asked for a more perfect experience. Our table was ready and prepared the moment we walked in and we were warmly greeted by both of the owners. From the moment we sat down, we were treated as royalty. Our drink orders were promptly taken as well our menu choices and every item came out hot, fresh and delicious. I ordered the blackened salmon and they had the fried seafood platter and both were scrumptious with great flavor, seasoning and portion sizes. I cleaned my plate! I also appreciate the fact that the owners took the time to greet us and introduce themselves, I felt that it really gave the visit such a personal touch. I really wanted my family to have an amazing experience for New Years Eve and the Red Snapper Seafood Restaurant did not disappoint. In fact, they’ve gained new patrons that can’t wait to return. I most definitely recommend this restaurant and hope you’ll give them a visit so that you can experience their culinary excellence for yourselves.

So I live directly next to this place but have never actually tried it. I always run by it and it’s in a weird looking building so I didn’t give it much thought. But one day, my girlfriend decides we’re trying it so I decide why not? Well, we go and I order the Hess Chardonnay, and they bring it out in no time filled to the rim and chilled to the perfect temperature. I ordered the Snapper Gourmet and my girlfriend had the Mixed Vegetable Salad. Boy oh boy did our food come quickly and cooked to perfection. The Snapper was delicious and I’m sad I overlooked this place for so long. 10/10 would recommend

This place is my preferable site.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. when  I feel like having a superb dinner, this place comes instantly to my mind. fresh and all kinds of  food and a large menu.courteous crew, and agreeable spirit. And very important, the cost is affordable. I sent my friends to this restaurant with pleasure.

So I’m honestly VERY sad about how my evening went here. See I had been coming here since I was a little girl - well over 20 years - tonight was my first time back after a while. It was like the place was completely different and I had no idea why - I later found out it was under new ownership 😢. The gumbo was remarkable in the past, I’ve never had a complaint - tonight it was not, it didn’t taste good. The snapper fingers were fried in what tasted like some kind of cheap fish fry. They used to be my favorite. They had a light batter on them before. These have now been butchered. Please get some of the old folks back In there so the taste of the food is what we all know and love. We used to love celebrating special occasions here but I don’t think I’ll be back after tonight. I s xx mean it really saddens me to say this. My waiter was kinda jittery also. Very flighty. Kept a as forgetting things. Was dazed for a few seconds, it was very unsettling. I just want it back to the way it used to be.

This was an impromptu dinner after leaving Lenox and so our first time here.  The food was GREAT.. !! 
To start the Gumbo had substance and just the right spice kick... Snapper Yvonne  &  Salmon cooked perfectly!
The conversation, suggestions and service from  both John & Claire was excellent!!!
We will return and bring friends!!🤗

name: The Melting Pot
address: 754 Peachtree St NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: We made a reservation for 5:15pm but we finished our tours early and went ahead at 4pm. They allowed us to go ahead and dine. The staff there is wonderful. They constantly checked on us to make sure we had everything we needed. And the food was delicious! This was our second visit and it was just as great as the first time. Thanks again!
Love this place. It was so awesome. We recieved top notch treatment and excellent table side service.

Great experience.  The food is really good.  Definitely not a place to go regularly because the whole point of going out is to not have to cook imo.  Staff was super friendly.  Don't rely on their online reservations if you want the romance package or something where the table needs to be setup.  Unfortunately my table was supposed to have rose pedals and a rose and it did not.  If you've never been.. Definitely go.
We had a wonderful server who made the experience much more enjoyable! Great date night spot!

This location is in the center of it all. The food was beautifully plated, looked and tasted fresh. The staff was very attentive, and made our entire group feel welcomed. If you like chocolate and peanut butter ... Try, "The Original Signature", Milk Chocolate & Crunchy Peanut Butter dessert, and dip a piece of pineapple ... You'll love it!

name: Murphy's Restaurant
address: 997 Virginia Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA
reviews: After a few dozen visits over the years, we have yet  to have a disappointing meal. Local, fresh and delicious. The service is always very good. We always arrive early to be at the rush. Great location for a cocktail at the bar before diner.

I love grabbing brunch or lunch or even dinner occasionally at the bar, especially when I am in a rush. They serve the full restaurant menu and the service is friendly and very quick. The specials are usually interesting and creative. My standby favorite is the meatloaf which they do really well. Great atmosphere. Great drinks. Pricey brunch food but worth the experience.

Awe, a farm to table restaurant.  The coffee here is strong and good. The food was good also. Service was fast and efficient. Chicken sausage was spicy, we placed orders to go for it, it was delicious.  The bloody Mary was freshly made and strong. The strawberry lavender jelly was a hit. My wife loved it. She took some to go! I had the chicken parmigiana, it was pretty good. Could of used a little bit of salt and pepper.

My family and I have become “repeat” customers at this nice restaurant because of several reasons including: variety of menu selection, good location, great brunch on weekend’s, exceptional service from the front desk and the bartenders. We specially enjoy the Saturday or Sunday’s brunch specials served until 4pm; and we don’t miss it when we’re in town, once a month. The staff including Anna V & the team of servers are very professional, friendly, quick, and customer-focused; something you don’t see in some high-rated and popular venues in town. We’ll come back here and we highly recommend this place!

Place is good. Came with a few friends for brunch on a Saturday morning. It was about 10am and it wasn't too busy. I should note that you will not be seated unless your entire party is there - even without a reservation. With that, we sat at the bar and waited on our late friend. Bartender was nice and talkative, but not so much they he became a part of the conversation. It's a solid menu with lots of egg based choices along with a nice drink menu. Multiple types of mimosas. I think the average price of mimosas was $10. There is also a burger included on the menu for Brunch. The French toast was excellent. Would recommend.

name: Mediterranea Restaurant & Bakery
address: 332 Ormond St SE, Atlanta, GA 30315, USA
reviews: The food here is delicious. The service attentive and kind. I can only imagine that comes from good leadership. Love this place. Oh, and my husband has a gluten sensitivity and the entire menu caters to that. But you'd never know. It's not something they flaunt. It's just a really good restaurant that happens to be #glutenfreefriendly.

The voltini is amazing. Fresh, crisp flavors with a hint of smokiness in the cheese. The service was awesome, especially given I showed up with a backpack and a plastic cup of tea because I'd just come from the zoo. The music sets a lovely note, as well. The white Christmas lights on the wall were the only off element in a lovely dinner.
Incredibly skilled professional chef coming out with some delicious plates. Beautiful relaxing upstairs patio with a nice view of the park. Old fashioned on point.

Nice staff, beautiful location and place, extremely price. The food is good. We order a casserole that was waaaaaaayyyyyy too much spicy. The drinks are medium, and I don’t feel like I would come back for their coffee. Anyways, you pay for the place. It is a nice place if you don’t care for good food.

Stopped in from traveling.  Not very many places dedicated to gluten free so my husband (not gluten free) and I were grateful to find this restaurant.  Not only does this place have great food, it has a comfortable environment.  We had the orange marmalade cream cheese french toast, cheddar chive biscuit & herb chicken gravy, and cheesy polenta grits. They were all very good! The only down side was the gravy was cold (my husband ate most of the gravy and had some health issues a few hours later.  Perhaps due to cold gravy or might have been due to other reasons.) The restaurant and restrooms were clean.  I would stop and eat here again!  I also got some bakery items to go.  My niece liked the cherry pecan scone.  I would suggest anyone handling any food not touch food product with hands/fingers after handling other things.  I would like to believe and hope the situation was incidental or careless at the moment.

name: Alma Cocina Downtown
address: 191 Peachtree St NE Suite 100, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: Modern Mexican cuisine in the heart of Atlanta. Great authentic mole, terrific service and a menu that makes me hungry just thinking about it. If I were a tequila drinker I'd have been tempted by their ENORMOUS selection (Mezcal too). Portions were huge and fairly reasonably priced. Definitely recommend.

Visited while on a business trip and really enjoyed the food. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable of the menu, which made it an easy experience.

I ordered the Chicken Chorizo street tacos with the rice and beans as well as the potatoes. I was not a fan of the corn tortillas, but the tacos were great! I’m not a rice and beans fan so believe me when I say the rice and black beans are delicious. They put fresh chopped tomatoes on top and it sets off the dish. The potatoes had a delicious Parmesan and tomato sauce and there were enough in one serving for the table to share. 

Overall, the price was reasonable for the tacos and the food was excellent. The waitress was a bit aggressive about us looking at the alcohol list, which was off putting, but not a deal breaker. I can say I had a great time and would definitely visit again.

We like a lot to go out. Yesterday we came to this superb restaurant which we didn’t know before. We enjoyed a lovely time there with excellent meal and an efficient team and an impressive cook. We put this restaurant in our phone list  and we shall surely go again very soon.  Highly recommended.

This is seriously one of the best meals we've ever eaten. The flavors were sweet, smokey, salty and delicious. We tried the sampler of guacamole and salsas followed by the empanadas and then the tacos. We would actually stop in Atlanta to have this food again. Service was amazing and prices were reasonable. Highly recommended!
Food was pretty good. Busy night so slow service. Overall it's worth a try if your around the area

name: Folk Art Restaurant
address: 465 North Highland Avenue Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: I stopped by for brunch on Friday, and I was impressed with the entire experience. It's a cozy spot in a nice location. My server, Brittany was very friendly, and helpful. I'm from out of town, and she answered my questions and provided excellent service. I had the Foul Play, which is chicken and waffles, with a side of hot peach, and it was wonderful. I cleaned the plate! L5P is an 8 minute walk through a quiet neighborhood with beautiful trees. I'll definitely return next time I'm in town.

Went around 4:30 on a Saturday. Plenty of parking available behind the block of stores and restaurant. Sat quickly and brought glasses of ice water. Ordered the meatball burger and lobster rolls; both with the flat-top Mac and cheese. Food didn’t take long to prepare. Burger was cooked well and very flavorful. Lobster rolls had a good amount of lobster. Neither of us were overly impressed with the Mac and cheese; not a fan of the cheese they used. Would like to return for the brunch or to try other menu items. Very “hipster” atmosphere, but family friendly.

This place is awesome! I HIGHLY recommend the pigs in a blanket. The grit fritters are okay, but they would be better if they were served hot. I also got the country fried which was alright when hot but definitely needed more country gravy. The chicken on it was perfectly cooked though. I also got the sweet potato waffle. I wasn't crazy about the peach compote but the chicken was perfectly cooked and the waffle was hands down the best waffle I've ever had. Definitely recommend.

Holy mother of God...this food is delicious! We had the Randy for an appetizer which is bacon dipped in pancake batter—-haaaalelujah. Then I had cinnamon bun French toast which was melting in my mouth. The inside is also ADORABLE and in the best location. I’ll definitely be back!

While the service was great and I loved the atmosphere, overall it was a pretty average brunch. I ordered two eggs over easy with turkey sausage, grits and toast. Eggs were good, though the turkey sausage was pretty low quality. We also were up charged for “in-house jelly” but we’re not told it would be extra (same with subbing fruit for grits). The French toast was also okay. The eggs Benedict with salmon was probably the best order, though the food was about the quality you would expect for a very standard brunch you could make at home (nothing that special).

name: Ray's In the City
address: 240 Peachtree St, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: We came to Ray's for Valentine's day. My wife had Lobster Bisque, Surf N' Turf and a dessert I don't remember but she was satisfied with each course more than the last. Our waitress, Danielle, was great also. Even though the place was busy she made us feel like we were her only diners and she gave great recommendations. We will definitely be back and I will recommend it to anyone else.

Good Service, Good quality of food (fresh), recently priced for the quality/food. The ambiance is good as well. Everyday they have a happy hour from 5-9pm with a drink at a good price and some bites. Best to make a reservation for dinner time since it’s even hard to find a spot at the bar if you just walk in!

A very clean and a friendly staff at this location.  We came in with a group of over 10 people, we were seated within 10 minutes and had a wide selection of delicious food options available to us.  Food was prepared and served to us in a timely fashion. The servers were very helpful and made sure that we had full drinks at all times. The after dinner wait for the bill was very short and the prices were very reasonable.  The atmosphere of the place was very laid back and comfortable for all of us.  I would definitely recommend this establishment for anyone who enjoys a good dinner, good wine and a family style dinner or casual drink and munch.

We had Chaianne as our server for a girls lunch last weekend. I arrived at the restaurant almost an hour before my friends and she was more helpful to assist me with a phone situation and chat before they arrived. Once dining she offered great drink and food selections. The food exceeded expectations and the atmosphere was sophisticated. We had a great time and will be back!

I went here on 2/1 to celebrate my birthday. The service, food, & atmosphere were very nice. There were a couple people who weren’t dressed up to match the dress code but, otherwise it was a nice evening. There was also live music which gave a nice vibe to sit and listen.

name: Morton's The Steakhouse
address: 303 Peachtree Center Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: This is a hidden gem nestled off Peachtree Center Avenue.  Being here for a conference was very nice considering the adequate space. The food was delicious and one of the treats were the garlic green beans.  I chose the salmon which was a great choice, however it left me wondering just how good the steak would have been.

It’s true, these are the best steakhouses. My steak was the best. Not a noisy restaurant at all and our server Lenny was great! A chain restaurant that continues to live up to its high standards. Absolutely recommend and it’s located so centrally downtown. Perfect as it offers both outdoor and indoor seating.

This is the first time I traveled to Atlanta with my mom.I browsed about most restaurants nearby hotel we stay,and Morton’s meets my requirements for steak and seafood. I order bone-in ribeye 16oz(nice texture and well made but too too big for lady,the taste worth the price and Prime USDA),scallops and lobster was also a WOW.Side dishes as spinach with mushroom and jumbo asparagus were outstanding either. Nice service,nice restaurant!

I celebrated my PhD today in this fine place. Well we had a magnificent evening and the venue was evidently one of the reasons for this fruitful event. The waiters  cooperated in a splendid way, the cooking was delicious and my guests were extremely  joyful. We shall absolutely visit again for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

I like this spot! They have fantastic dishes, their menu is nice, The chief cook in that restaurant is an expert, I enjoy a lot tasting all their food. The dishes are consistently of high class, the attitude towards the guests  is friendly. I frequently visit this restaurant and I was never unsatisfied. I recommend it with no hesitation.

name: Sun Dial
address: 210 Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews: The view was spectacular.  The food was great!  Portion sizes surprised me. (Pleasantly)  Both myself and my date had to take to go boxes.  The staff was courteous, if not friendly.  The ambiance was a little lacking. (We went for lunch though) My date and I were dressed businesses casual.  She in a nice black dress and heels, me in dress pants, a button down shirt and a blazer, and they seated us across from a group of, what had to be, a teenage cheerleader squad, dressed in sweats and quite raucous.  Luckily, they left before our meal arrived so we could hear each other speaking without having to raise our voices for the rest of our lunch.  I would like to see how they address the dinner crowd before I pass final judgment on ambiance...so I will definitely be back!

Really nice and professional staff. High end restaurant with stellar food. Pricy but similar to any other fine dining restaurant. I got the chicken and waffles came out in a very timely manner. I also really like that they give you complementary muffins to hold you over until the food is ready. Also the view is worth it all good I also like that you can go above where you eat and look through binoculars down into the town.

You simply cannot beat the views and service.  I took my future Mrs. here and she loved it.  I do miss the fact it doesn't spin around anymore.  Prayers definitely go up still to the family.  I hope that one day it'll be allowed to turn again.  It's always great to schedule a time to go when it's still much daylight and watch the sunset into the night.

Just left there and it was a wonderful experience. Staff was really nice. The server knew the money and made ordering drinks and food simple. She even took a photo of us. The Georgia trout was delicious. My bf ordered the seafood pasta and the from what I tasted the scallops were delicious. The vanilla cheesecake was also really good. I was disappointed that it still has not started spinning again, but I’m sure they have their reasons. We did walk around and look at the view as well.

The food was pretty good. Our waiter (Mike) was nice and accommodating. We were actually allowed to pack food-to-go in a fancy place with a special holiday menu. The view was beautiful at night, and the valet service was free when I mentioned it at the seating desk on the way out. Although I'm willing to spend money on good food..the meals were too pricey. Again the food was pretty good but not the best I've had. Half is for the view and top service, the other half is location. Will come back another time when the menu isn't for something special.

name: 8ARM
address: 710 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA
reviews: My husband and I are huge foodies and 8Arm has by far been our standout of this past year. You can count on Maricela to surprise you with all of the flavor and ingredients. I never thought I would enjoy a mushroom more than the way she can magically dish it up. If you’re with a small group, I’d recommend ordering the entire menu (it’s smaller) and eating family style so you get to try everything! Bonus is that they source all their ingredients from local Georgia farmers so you can trust you are not only eating the best but supporting local!

8ARM is a go to for me because I always know the food and drinks will be GREAT! You can always count of them to have some great season fare and libations to match. They are also open late so it makes for a great after event place to relax and eat.

One of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta. Food is art here, and you can tell how passionate the staff and owners are with every bite. Love the changing menu. Love the vibe. Great service, always. (my kind of service. don't talk to me unless I talk to you. just tell me about the food I'm ordering and answer my dumb questions when I have them.) Great date spot. Great brunch spot. Perfect place for those who are looking for something different and fresh.

Food was very tasty. We came through for Sunday brunch and there were literally 3 people waiting tables for the whole place, and only one for the outside (which was still just three groups). Everything else about the place is so cool but it was just frustrating to have to sit 2.5 hours just for one mimosa and a chicken biscuit. Mega bummer. ALSO MY COFFEE WAS ONLY THREE OUNCES AND I ONLY WAS ABLE TO GET ONE REFILL THAT I HAD TO GET UP TO GET. (See photo)

I thought that was it. THE PAPAS BRAVAS CAME OUT WITH 8 TINY POTATO PIECES WHAT IS THIS OK ITS FOUR DOLLARS THIS ISNT EVEN A PORTION.
Drinks were good. However, they need better accommodations or a better way to handle when it rains. It rained inside during the entire event, limiting where you can gather.

name: Kevin Rathbun Steak
address: 154 Krog St NE STE 200, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: We like a lot hanging out. Last night we arrived in this excellent restaurant which we didn’t know before. We had a beautiful experience there with excellent meal and a professional crew and  a professional cook. We  added this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we will surely visit again very soon. We deeply recommend.

I would go again. Our bartender/waitress Amber was really nice very personable. The restaurant has a very nice ambiance lighting is dim everything you look for in an upscale place. Now, the most important part the food! I love steak houses so I've been to quite a few and I usually look for the upscale ones to get a nice steak. KEVIN RATHBUN did not disappoint on that. Very good well seasoned NY STRIP 16OZ STEAK I ordered the OSCAR topping (crab) just amazing. Their jalapeno cream corn was surprisingly very GOOD! It wasn't spicy at all but great flavor throughout. Speaking of flavor you have to try the bacon appetizer(in the picture)!!!The mashed potatoes however were disappointing they taste like they come from mix or a box and the creamed spinach was a bit on the salty side. They did not have Crown apple (my favorite) but Amber suggested regular crown with some apple pucker. It wasn't the same but it was close and I appreciate her trying.
Excellent steaks and other fine dining. The seafood is always fresh and the vegetables nicely cooked. Pleasant wait staff and a subdued atmosphere.

Indulge! It's totally worth the price! I spent $150. The atmosphere was really upscale. Service was impeccable. The drinks were stiff, but tasty. I ordered the crab cake appetizer, the 20 oz ribeye, half size portions of the Mac and cheese & steamed broccoli. My drink of the night was the Old Irv. I had 2! Everything was soooooooo good! I even finished off everything with a slice of cheesecake for dessert.

A perfect dining experience. Great atmosphere..My date loved the appetizers, especially the thick cut grilled bacon. The stakes was cooked to perfection and seafood  was amazing. Not to mention the deserts. I'll definitely be back again.

name: Sotto Sotto Restaurant
address: 313 North Highland Avenue Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: The ambiance is lovely. The wine selection...very strong and the server quite knowledgeable. The scallops were seared to perfection and creamy in the middle. The seafood risotto truly delightful (even though there was a bit of sand from the clam and mussel shells). The downfall was the special of the evening...the pheasant. The mushrooms and potatoes that came with it were excellent (overlooking the one bite of sand left on the mushrooms)...but the pheasant itself was very dry. I have had succulent pheasant on more than one occasion...so it CAN be done...just not this time. Overall I wish all of the plates had a little more color...each dish was a little too "brown"...more edible greenery (especially for the scallops and pheasant) would not have hurt anything at all. That being said...everything was good enough where I would come back and willingly try other dishes.

Fantastic Italian restaurant. My friends and I came here to celebrate a birthday and it was a fantastic experience.

Food: The wine that was recommended a Tuscan blend paired really well with everything that we ordered from the mozzarella with tomatoes to the two pasta dishes. The pasta was excellent and fresh. Some of the best I’ve tasted in Atlanta.

Service: the waitress we had was courteous, professional, and took excellent care of us. She made the dining experience that much better.

Atmosphere: This restaurant is cozy and comfortable. This is the kind of environment I look for when I go get Italian food. Reminded me a lot of restaurants in Verona.

The lasagne, the duck pasta dish, the spinach gnocchi.......it’s all so good. A very nice restaurant for either a special occasion, business meal or just an evening out for some great food. Our waiter recently was very passionate about wine and we had a great evening with friends trying lots of different wines. Food is fantastic and we found the service to be excellent aswell. I’m a regular at Italian restaurants and this is an excellent one.

This is a very nice Italian restaurant. They have appropriate portion sizes and can help make an evening special. They have good drinks, within the realm of what is normally paired with Italian food. Their waitstaff are nice and accomodating. They place is very clean and more attractive looking than photos would suggest- its actually quite romantic and cozy. It is smaller than you would think, though, so I would make reservations on busy nights to be safe.

Their homemade pasta dishes are undeniably the most perfect food to solve any problems in life. I’ve had better pasta at Sotto Sotto than in Italy. The servers are so knowledgeable on wine, it takes the thinking out of it. Let them make a suggestion for your dish. Also, a great place for night cap drinks as their tiny bar is a great local gathering hole. ;)

name: Rathbun's
address: 112 Krog St NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: Amazing place! Very interesting menu that makes you want to order it all or come back again. Great job guys and gals of Rathbun's.

We ate dinner here with another couple friends. I would say that their food are amazing. I ordered the roasted bone marrow appetizer and I find the taste and flavor interesting. The steak that I ordered was cooked to perfection. My friends were also impressed on the service the server provided. Hope to come back here again!

An excellent restaurant serving excellent food with an amazing level of service, detail and dedication to their guests. An Atlanta institution as they've been operating at a high level for a really long time. Great place for a romantic night on the town or just to get great food in general.

We reserved the wrong restaurant😂😂 But the food was still good! Service was nice. We did have to wait a little bit more than our reservation time, but not too much. We just spent some time at the market across. This places uses a lot of seasoning in their food which I didn't hate, but if someone is very sensitive to strong flavors, be careful. Still, had a pleasant experience!

There were five of us, and it was absolutely WONDERFUL. The cocktails to start were well prepared, and the wine selection for dinner was extensive. Two of us shared the Porterhouse for two, and they loved it. And the rest of us got single steak offerings and all were cooked to prefection (medium rare), and the sides were equal to the task. We shared - their sides are somewhat family size and enough for two. We tried the broccoli, risoto with mushrooms and creamed spinach, and all were delicious! The service was very good, and the atmosphere matches the service and food.

name: Lure
address: 1106 Crescent Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
reviews: The experience was amazing. Celebrating my cousin's Birthday here was the perfect decision on his part. The drinks pack a little punch. All the food was fresh and fulfilling. Lighting was a little too dim, but overall I definitely  would like to  go back  and  try much more on the menu. Maybe  even visit their Taco place nearby as well.

I stayed around the corner so I looked online for something nearby. I was VERY PLEASANTLY SURPRISED with the unique flavors and very high quality of the food. It was my first night and I considered myself lucky. I had a drink at the bar and it was amazing too! It will be my first stop the next time I'm in Midtown Atlanta.

I had such a great time at this restaurant on Easter. Excellent customer service and with reservations we were seated immediately. I love how they set up the menu and how they presented the 3 course meal.   They had free valet parking. We will be back.

Another restaurant that deserves  your patronage in midtown Atlanta. Loved the decor and the overall feel of the restaurant is elegant and cozy. The wait staff was attentive even with a packed house which I always appreciate.  We sampled the crab dip, scallops and fried catfish.  All were delicious and the scallops were cooked perfectly. My only small grievance was that we sat outside and had to battle a few ants while we dined.

We’ve been to Lure twice and it is excellent! Fantastic service and great food. I had the trout both times and it may have been the best trout I ever had. They also have great ceviche, hush puppies, and desserts. The ambiance is also nice and the restaurant is well designed.

name: Agave Restaurant
address: 242 Boulevard SE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews: I love this place. We’ve been coming for almost twenty years. The service is impeccable, ambiance perfect, food is so fresh and smart. Drinks and wine are always classy. Not only that they’re crazy generous with the neighborhoods around here with fundraising and giving back. We love coming here on a date night, big family occasions, out of town visitors, rowdy birthdays, etc. Keep up the good work.

I was in Atlanta for one day. My search for dining options produced fast food or overpriced results.  Agave's description seemed to fit that niche of local spot with good options at reasonable prices.  Their Southwest cuisine made me wish I was in town longer.  The food was great.  The atmosphere was cozy.  The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Too bad the CV-19 issue shut down restaurants the next day.  If they offer take-out during the pandemic shut-down, PLEASE support these folks.  I'll make it a point to come back next time I'm in town.

Stopped by Saturday night because we heard the food was good.  It was better than good.  Best meal I've ever had.  The prime NY strip was amazing.  And that's coming from someone that has never had a NY strip I've liked.  My wife loved her tuna.  Pic is after she started eating it.  Margaritas were good.  Salsa was super fresh and great flavor.   Food and drinks were reasonably priced.  Only small downside is the tables are a bit close together where we were but hey I understand they have a business to run.  I wish this place was closer to my home.  We will definitely be back!!
Been back twice since.  Food and service have been awesome!

Food was good and portion sizes were large. Most things were reasonably priced as well. 

All restaurant employees were super friendly and helpful.
