Complimentary valet parking helps because there isn’t a ton of parking in the area. Wait times for tables can be long on the weekends and there isn’t a lot of space inside to wait. There is patio outside where you can wait when the weather is warm.

Great food and drinks! Had a peach margarita. For an appetizer, had southwest shrimp egg rolls - delicious! My friend had the beef medallions and I had the Tequila shrimp. They were all really good. When we arrived, free valet parking. Casual dress. Very nice greeter and wait staff. Chips and salsa - homemade. So good! Want to return to try guacamole next.

name: Ecco Midtown
address: 40 7th St NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
reviews: My daughter and I went here for dinner prior to going to the Fox to see a Wicked this past weekend. We arrived 30 minutes prior to our reservation, so we sat at the bar, where Chris, the bartender took very good care of us. While they were out of the rum needed to make the drink my daughter wanted (not sure why the drink is still on the menu), we each wound up enjoying a nice glass of wine.

Loved my meal and experience here! My favorite with the charcuterie. The soft cheese we had was amazing as well as the spicy salami. 

I had the rabbit gnocchi. The flavor was good but a little on the salty side and the gnocchi was a little too soft for my taste.

My boyfriend got the pappardelle and loved it! 

Service was good as well. Would definitely come back and try the goat cheese balls next time.

Great date spot! The atmosphere is perfect- I especially love getting to sit outside when it’s warm enough. The food is so good and rotated occasionally so there are new things on the menu. My favorite of their classics is the fried goat cheese balls- they are so good and what I look forward to most when I visit.

Have enjoyed Ecco plenty of times with the hubs but never a large group. 12 of us dined there as part of a business meeting this week. Our server, Nick, was on it. He gave me some coaching on ordering so I could avoid the terminal wait for apps and drinks that you sometimes suffer through with a large group. Everyone was thrilled with the selection and the noise level wasn't too bad - sure the folks on the ends couldn't talk across the entire table but it was easy to pull 4-5 folks into a conversation.

Great menu and good atmosphere. Charcuterie was amazing. Duck entree was great. Service was outstanding.

Desert menu was good and wine was dynamite. Easy in and out. Would definitely dine here again.

name: Anis Cafe & Bistro
address: 2974 Grandview Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: Absolutely gorgeous restaurant. My wife and had an awesome time here, we sat outside although it was a warm Summer afternoon. There were fans all over the place to kill the heat. And of course they have a large wine menu. I ordered trout and it was well cooked, and before that the fresh bread and butter was killer. All in all we enjoyed the vibe and definitely recommend the place.

I celebrated my birthday today in this great place. happy to tell that we enjoyed a outstanding evening and the place was indeed the reason for the outstanding evening. The stuff  participated in a gorgeous manner, the meals were tasty and my buddies were very  overjoyed. We shall definitely come back again for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

We have dined here for years. The owner, Arnaud , usually welcomes us as at the door and we catch up with him for a few minutes. The food is always spectacular, and the service is on point. Very traditional French. We’ve always had great meals here and suggest saving room for dessert. The bread pudding is fantastic. You can sit on the patio year round, and note, there is a very private side patio if you’re looking for a more intimate setting.

We have dined here for years. The owner, Arnaud , usually welcomes us as at the door and we catch up with him for a few minutes. The food is always spectacular, and the service is on point. Very traditional French. We’ve always had great meals here and suggest saving room for dessert. The bread pudding is fantastic.

Cute, authentic French bistro.   Eclectic styling.  Small menu.  Affordable.  Went for lunch and kept thinking it would be a really nice place to take a date.   

Not stuffy at all.   Very cozy with a rustic vibe.  Clientele was a bit annoying, but hey... it's a French restaurant in the south.  What can you do?  

Had the croque monsieur and French fries.   Very delicious. 

Teddy was upset that I didn't bring him leftovers.   See photo.

name: Nakato Japanese Restaurant
address: 1776 Cheshire Bridge Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30324, USA
reviews: Enjoyed a great dinner. We did not have a reservation and were seated at a hibachi table within ten minutes of arrival. The food was very well prepared and tasty. The portion was more than enough, having enough for leftovers. We had the Hibachi shrimp and steak and scallops. The meals came with soup, salad, noodles, veggies and white or fried rice. I would recommend this restaurant.

This was my first time having hibachi in years, and Nakato provided a great experience! The servers and chef were great. It was very entertaining to watch, and we got  LOTS of food. The teriyaki chicken was delicious, and the sauce they served made it even better!  It was my boyfriend’s birthday, so they sang him a song and brought him ice cream with a candle, which was sweet. Look forward to returning!

This place is really good. The food quality is also top notch. I ordered chicken and shrimp and it was delicious. It comes with bunch of sides such as soup, salad, and some apps (depending on what you select) and also fried rice. The chefs presentation was spot on too. 

Tip: It gets crowded so have a reservation. 
Tip: They cook vegetarian and meat food on sale grill. So that could be an issue with some vegetarian folks.

The ambiance is nice, though it's high energy and therefore can be pretty loud. You can reserve seats at a public hibachi table or if you have a group you can get a semi-private room (there are also regular tables in a separate dining room if you just want you order from the menu). The value for what you get is just average I'd say since they don't give you very large portions, but it's a fun place.

Service was really good. The food was good, however portions a little small for the price. The place was very clean looking and had good ambiance modern with history. The only issue I had was that a party of 5 without alcohol and no desert one appetizer cost $180.00 we didn't even get anything special. The other issue was you had valet parking so your obligated to tip and that adds more to the cost. Otherwise the place was nice and the food was good, not great when compared to other restaurants that charge the same prices.

name: King + Duke
address: 3060 PEACHTREE RD NW at, West Paces Ferry Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30305, USA
reviews: Interesting craft cocktails. Very good whiskey selection. Pricey menu, but the bread was excellent, the squash was good, the chicken was amazing, the potatoes were epic. Not too enthused about the green beans or the pork (overcooked). The desserts were ok and the coffee was good. Truly excellent service, clean bathrooms and good cocktails made up for a few of the food misses. Overall, worth the price.
Really great food! Chris, our server, was awesome and made good recommendations. We enjoyed it all. This was a special fixed price for Valentine’s Day 2020

Absolutely wonderful meal and service. We arrived early for our reservation but they were able to seat us right away (which I didn't expect). They accommodated my request for a mezcal cocktail and it was fantastic! My husband got the feast for 1 which was the steak with garlic. I got the coffee lamb with carrots. We shared the ricotta toast and waygu beef share plates. While all of it was fantastic, if I had to choose I'd go with the ricotta toast and feast. But honestly you can't go wrong here. The manager took my husband's coat and checked it for him, our server was kind and knowledgeable. Definitely worth checking this place out.

We had a fantastic lunch at King + Duke. We visited on a Tuesday just after 12 without a reservation and were seated immediately without any issue. We sampled a bit of everything - drinks, pop overs, sandwiches. All were delicious. The service was friendly and helpful. I look forward to going back!

Went for a birthday event. Table reservation was an hour late. There was complimentary drinks and appetizers for the mix up... host was very professional and knowledgeable of the entire menu. Ordered the most expensive steak offered (King 40oz bone in) along with the dry aged "L bone". Unfortunately for us the King was about 1/3 fat along with an okay steak. It was cooked properly, but was a poor cut of meat in my opinion. The "L bone" was not as tasty as I hoped. This could be due to the aging process though. It was a good cut with little fat on the meat anywhere. Others in our party had pork chops, they looked really good. Maybe I'll try those next time.

name: Atmosphere Restaurant
address: 1620 Piedmont Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30324, USA
reviews: This place is no doubt one of the most attractive place to eat in the region. Every time I go there I am extremely pleased. They hold their high  standard service and the highest level of cooking  they offer. You can never go wrong with this place. Very  recommended.

Enjoyed our dinner here! We tried quite a few things, the way beef appetizer was really fresh and juicy. Everything was great. But not used to the taste of the French onion soup here. The service was great and attentive. Since the restaurant was in a house, you will be seated in small rooms without a big crowd.
Lovely ambience and delicious food! Very easy-going staff, while also very professional. I can imagine that it will be wonderful to visit in warmer weather and to sit outside!
Amazing restaurant. Drove past for three years and finally made it inside, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was perfect for a date night. Will definitely be back soon.
Superb French cuisine. Lots of variety of choices, seasonal items and specials. Very friendly and attentive service. Ambiance that allows you to talk over your meal without having to shout.

name: AG
address: 181 Peachtree St, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
reviews:
I only give this place one star because at least the bartenders were attentive.
We walked in on a Tuesday early evening and asked for a table for 2. The hostess told us it would be about 45 minutes. My friend really looked forward to eating there and so I decided it was worth the wait. We went into the bar and were served two drinks and we went out in the lobby next to the hostess podium and sat down to wait. the hostess made no mention whatsoever during the entire time that there were any restrictions for priority seating.
There were about 10 smaller tables available when we started our wait. 1 hour past and we eagerly asked the hostess how much longer and she said "when I seat this couple, then you will be next".  She sat 3 couples between that moment and the 30 minutes that passed. We went over and complained and finally another staff told my friend that they had to seat the reservations from the hotel before anyone that is not staying at the hotel.
We were floored, we were dressed nicely, we did not feel like we somehow did not fit in but apparently this is how they treat non guests because two older gentlemen in business suits were also turned down. They had sat in the lounge waiting for about an hour also. Never have I felt so disenfranchised, needless to say I will never go back.

Booked the hide out room for my birthday. Had an amazing time. Timothy made the experience unforgettable. He was funny, nice and attentive. The food was great and Timothy was even better. Best birthday dinner I’ve had yet.

It could have easily been a 5 star review but my brunch experience made it a 3. I go to AG about 1-2 times every month for dinner. The food, service and ambience(indoors) is great. The first time I tried brunch, the place was almost empty but it took the waitress over an hour to serve us.  I ordered breakfast potatoes but they gave me fries. The french toast was soooo small that I passed by McDonalds after my meal to fill myself up. No joke! I tried brunch again and my experience was just as bad with the long wait times although the place was empty. 

Don't even think about having your food at the terrace - it's unbelievably noisy from the cars driving by.

Ribeye steak and brussel sprouts were really good. I asked for medium well and it came as described but it was a little dry so that's my fault. Next time I should get medium rare or medium. They gave free bread/scone with spices after I ordered and regular butter and spicy butter.

As long as I've lived in Atlanta, I've never set foot in Atlanta Grill as most I probably thought it was to ritzy for even myself... but I was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations and great wait staff. Our waitress made the experience wonderful! The food was delicious they had pretty good choices. I think the best dish was the crab cake but we noticed everyone around ordered fish and chips. The banana pudding french toast is to die for and the birthday peaches and cream cheesecake was everything ! Red velvet chicken and waffles were a little mushy and didn't offer much of any other chicken and waffle dish. Price point isn't bad but they are smaller culinary servings. Definitely will return and I hope I get the same young lady on the wait staff... I believe her name was Magdeline.

name: A Mano
address: 587 Ralph McGill Blvd NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
reviews: Easily five stars for this one. I would recommend sharing all the plates between two persons so you get to try more different plates. Plates sizes are perfect. I wouldn’t change a thing, all was delicious. Eating out 1 week in Atlanta and this is the best I found. Prices are also reasonable for the quality you get.

The service was exemplary (friendly, prompt, attentive, and eager to answer questions asked). 

The food was also noteworthy as members of  my party openly raved over the taste...pork chops, brussel sprouts, potatoes, even the bread pudding! Hats off to the chef!

Although the establishment is small and parking is limited, this restaurant more than adequately serves its community, and walking to it from a few blocks away is worth it.

A Mano's is a great restaurant.  The food, drinks and atmosphere are awesome.  I would highly recommend you try them out.  We will be back.  BTW Brendon (the bartender) was so talented.  He made our experience over the top!!!!!!

What a great little restaurant!  I have driven past this place for some time and finally decided to stop in and see what it is all about.

I love good grilled octopus and have eaten some of the best around the globe - the grilled octopus here is probably the best I have had anywhere.

Everyone's food in my group was great, the service was attentive and drinks delicious.

The only issue is parking - they only have a handful of spots but there is usually street parking on nearby neighborhood streets.

The best spot in the Old 4th Ward for quality and reliable Italian food. I’ve been coming here since they opened and love that there are some menu items that haven’t changed but still taste great each time (like the burrata & fusilli). I also thought the newest addition, butternut squash ravioli was a great option for vegetarians. Creamy and balanced out with the nuts & apple. Also enjoyed their peach soda, the lavender one was too strong.

Parking - limited lot parking, mainly free street parking

name: Fritti
address: 309 North Highland Avenue Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA
reviews: Fritti has great specialty pizzas, salads, and delicious Italian food. Great wine list and the atmosphere is relaxing with indoor and outdoor seating. You truly get the vibe of the neighborhood when the doors are open and you watch the people walking by and hear the buzz of the street. Great food, service, and location.

The food was great, the atmosphere was amazing, the drinks were well made and the service was on point. Nothing can go wrong with this place, it was an outstanding experience. One of the best pizzas in Atlanta!!

I wasn't expecting this place to be good but it really went beyond my expectations. The pizzas were great, appetizers were amazing, and gelato was on point. I think the skewers could be a little better but overall I give this place a five star.

Went here last night at 11:00 P.M. an hour before closing and normally we get bad customer service at some places when you come at the end of the day. In this case customer service was phenomenal. The food was brought out at a decent time, our drinks were great and the pizza was delicious. So happy that we found this cool pizza joint in the city. We are definitely coming back!

I adore this restaurant! They provide superb meals, they have a rich menu, The chef in that spot is well trained, I like a lot trying all their food. The dishes are always of high qualtity, the service towards the guests  is nice. I visit often this place and I not even once was disappointed. I recommend it to all.
